text:
This is by far the best breakfast place around!

This a smaller restaurant where you seat yourself at a variety of home style tables and are greeted by ever-changing paintings on the wall created by a local artist. The waitstaff here are young, as described in other posts, but we have always found them to be hard at work, always asking us what we need, making sure to get us our drinks quickly, and greeting customers as they come in. They even get to know their customers, and know regular drink and food orders. 

As for the food - well it is EXCELLENT! Now, I have only had breakfast here, but I have never had a bad meal. The home fries are Amazing, and are not full of grease or salt like you might get from larger chains. Everything is cooked fresh to order so most meals can be adjusted to your needs and since there are so many choices you can really create your own meal beyond what their menu has. The food also comes out super quick, considering there's only one or two cooks at a time, and everything is always delicious. 

My husband and I go here at least once a month, and we will continue to frequent this little shop as long as we live in Vegas. Some personal food recommendations - The Bacon sandwich is a go to for us, and if you want something to satisfy your sweet tooth, definitely opt in for their whipped cream on your pancakes as it is rich and creamy and very yummy. 

This restaurant is worthy of its 5-star rating from me!

Small and clean. Meals are Home-cooked style and delicious. Deco is homey with local n beautiful arts on the walls for purchase. Location is perfect for its style, in a local small community off of the city buzz. Love it!!

2nd time eating here, We drive 35 miles from Henderson to enjoy this "Divine Eatery". I ordered the chorizo Breakfast Burrito, It was fantastic. The food is fresh as the potatoes are cooked to order.  The 1st time we went I had the bacon Cheeseburger, it put all Cheeseburgers to shame. This will be a frequent place to visit. Worth the drive!! Thank you!
Divine Eatery is a hidden gem. The food is delicious and everything is made fresh. I had the BYO omelette and tried the nutty French toast. Both were amazing...I can't wait to come back!
Dirty and gross food.. I have no idea how this place has so many stars! Waste of money

Had a really good breakfast here! Service was excellent!!!!

I had chillaquilas. So very good. They were out of pork and added chicken (which I personally preferred). So much flavor. Yum!

The table had eggs Benedict (solid), French toast and stuffed French toast. ( both winners) We also had a light side breakfast with egg whites and spinach. All yummy.

Do your self a favor and stop in. You won't be disappointed.

Used to be much better and was our (my wife and I) go to breakfast restaurant.  Since the new owners have taken over we've tried multiple time to give it a chance.  The friendliness is not there (we miss you Joanne and Esther!).  The service each time since the new owners took over is not the same at all. The food was OK but better when Esther, the owner, was also the head chef.  We miss having the "old" Divine be our go to breakfast restaurant.

I'm giving this a 2 star because I like the food for the most part which that probably receives a 4 star. But the reason I'm giving it a 3 star is because I called in an order of chili cheese fries, but before I placed the order I asked the young lady who answered the phone how Big were the chili cheese fries? She replied by saying they were "pretty small." So I then proceeded to ask if two people could possibly share them?

I'm not sure what she thought I meant, or if she wasn't aware of the actual size of the chili cheese fries. But I feel like she either isn't sure of her job or if she was trying to up sell me more food. Either way I didn't like the tactics, I would recommend this place if you don't feel like driving a few more minutes to Baby stacks.
Best club sandwich ever. Thick cut bacon, delicious herb mayo and an awesome side of cole slaw made for a great meal. Friendly service, decent prices, nice and clean. We will be going back.

I would put zero stars but you don't have that option and I guess the lady who served us was nice. The reason being is we had to wait 35 minutes for a chorizo burrito and a small plate of huevos rancheros. In all honesty that shouldnt take that long. They weren't even busy. On top of that the people who came in after us got their food before us. All In all I am very unsatisfied and I don't see how they got 4 stars. Yelp sucks!

The Divine Eatery is delicious! All the food is made to order, they don't even own a freezer! The staff is amazing and attentive. I love that they always offer my husband and I a to go cup, we never need a box because the food is just to good to not clean your plate.

Very disappointing. Why are they charging $4 for a plain cup of coffee? When I asked for Sweet'N Low because all they had was sugar, raw sugar, and stevia in the raw, I was told by the waitress they don't have Sweet'N Low and lest I think they're just out, no. The owner said she WILL NOT carry all the different brands of sweetener. Lots of people I know use Sweet'N Low and it's one of the cheaper sweeteners so why the stance against carrying what many people want? There aren't that many choices on the menu. My companion and I both got the Divine Throwback. $10 for two eggs, two strips of bacon, home fries, and 2 pancakes. It's $1 extra to substitute red velvet pancakes or french toast. My friend got the red velvet pancakes. She liked them. I got french toast. I wanted regular french toast and got pecan caramel french toast. One piece of regular bread cut into two triangles. The food was good and the service was friendly. However, other than the red velvet pancakes, nothing I can't make at home. I thought the prices were quite high for what you get. There are other places nearby that have similar food with more choices for cheaper prices. We ended up spending $30 minus tax and tip. $15 a person for breakfast? I don't mind paying more when I'm getting my money's worth. I didn't feel that was the case here. Also, other people are commenting on the decor. It's odd certainly but I didn't mind it. What I did mind was that the table and chairs wobbled. I won't be back there.
Finally decided to make the drive to check it out. FAIL!!  It's closed. It's 9am so not sure what's going on.

This place is awesome!! The bacon sandwich with potatoes are the best! Great big portions and the service is good. I've never had a bad experience here. The place is a bit small but it has a great atmosphere. There only open till 2:00pm. I wish they would extend there hours but they specialize in breakfast and lunch.

A very cute,  small cafe. They have some pretty great breakfast options.  Everything is certainly made from scratch. The staff was friendly,  but not in your face friendly.  It was slow enough the chef even came out to see how things were which was nice.  The food was all quite good,  and her gravy was delicious.  It was also priced reasonably, all except the coffee which was $4, not a fancy drink just a cup of coffee. Will definitely be back.

I also wrote this on your Facebook page.  Your food is fantastic!  I just have two suggestions.  Please note while I do own a business, it is not a restaurant, however this advice applies to every business.  Because I own a business, I look out for my fellow small business owners.  As I explain below, I think you got something great, and rare, as your food is amazing and I want to see you succeed.  I am only writing this, as after seeing your new hours after just opening a few months ago, I had to write you, and I did not see a website, so this was my only way of writing you. 
First your hours.
Being that you are a new business, you got to pay your dues by being open longer.  Ask any business owner and they will tell you this, in the beginning you got to put in your hours to succeed, to build relationships, to get regulars by developing relationships with them.  11am -2pm during weekdays, would be okay if you were located downtown as you would get all the lawyers, and business' eating for lunch rush hours, but you are located in a residential area, where most of us are at work, and the stay at home moms are just starting their day, being located up here, I can't see how you aren't open after 5pm.  You can also loose future customers like regulars.  I am saying this from past experience.  In my business, I'm open 6 days a week, with long hours, but I too have emergencies, and sometimes post a letter on door saying I'm opening late, or am closed for a day, and I can't tell you how bad that pissed people off, they would write me that they wasted a drive, and how unprofessional it was, and they were right, as it can be quite annoying when you see a business closed after driving there and especially when its during business hours.  At first I thought they were just being petty, but learned quickly how many people it pissed off.  Eventually after growing you can cut down your hours, but for now you can't.  Because your rarely open, people will just give up all together, as most don't memorize your hours, and every time they come your closed.  Your food is so great, once word gets out you can also get customers from other areas in town to make the drive out to eat at your place, but you got to give it time for word to get out, and to keep getting referrals, as if they make the drive, and your closed you will loose them for good.  11am - 2pm up here is just pointless, you got to be open from noon to like 9pm, I thought closing at 5pm was bad, but 2pm is just not good.

Secondly know how expensive signs are, but one good future investment would be to get Divine Eatery letter sign next to your Cafe Sign above (or replace Cafe).  I know it's on the glass window and door, but you are missing a ton of business with to go orders, because a lot of people who don't know your business name can't call info (411) and get your number, as they will just see Cafe, and no one will think about looking at the window.  When you first open, I called 411 to make a to go order, and did not know your name, and there was nothing coming up for Café off Hualapai.  There are a lot of people, who are like me,who would probably prefer take out as they just got off work, and don't want to cook a meal for their family, so they would place a take out order with you. One suggestion I have is, maybe get a small, clean, classy banner to put above the Cafe sign, the City allows you to file for a 6month temp sign such as a banner (I had to do this with my business), and your allowed to file this once a year the fee is $100.  Now I don't know what your landlord rules are, but I'm sure if you pick a nice clean looking banner, they will have no problems. But this would give you time to save up for a new sign (I know their expensive as most simple signs start at $5,000) But your food is so good, I know if you eventually open for dinner during the week, you will get a ton of take out orders.  From business experience I have learned you got to pay your dues in the beginning, there are no shortcuts, and it takes time, time for word to get out, time for referrals, but once you give that time, it could really pay off.  Whatever you do, don't get frustrated and give up!.  Also, don't be shy, ask some food critics, or food journalists, to try out your food, as they can write a article about your place, it doesn't hurt to ask.  Sorry, I'm not trying to be overbearing but I know you have something special and I want to see you grow to your full potential, and because I have some business experience, I look out for my fellow small business owners (even when it's not my place to), and if I see some things that could help them, I offer my advice. As I know when you open a business its your dream, for most of us, we gave everthing we had, you just got to keep you dream burning, as one small mistake could close you.  But you are doing a great job, and as I said above your food is delicious!

What a great place, a hidden gem. I had the works breakfast with nutty French toast. The bacon had a nice smokey flavor. The French toast was amazing, it reminded me of my grandmothers pecan sticky rolls.  I will definitely be back.

My wife and I stopped in looking for a favorite breakfast spot having recently moved into the area.  The parking lot was deserted which should have tipped us off.  Upon entering the waiter, although polite, was not personable. The decor is eccletic and relatively sparse with an open view of the kitchen.

I ordered the "unred" velvet pancakes with no icing and a side of biscuits and gravy. My wife opted for the bacon bacon cheese and bacon plate.  With my pancakes they forgot to leave the icing off which wasn't a big deal except the cook berated the waiter in front of us and the one other patron that had arrived.  Extremely unprofessional in my eyes, if I want to see chefs yelling at people I will turn on the food network.  The pancakes themselves arrived with small light colored chuncks in them I assumed were nuts but in actuallity looked like hard clumps of batter. My biscuits and gravy were done well the gravy just a touch on the salty side.  My wife's bacon bacon cheese bacon plate was underwhelmingly bacony.  She left it half eaten due to the fact "it just didn't have much flavor".

Going in we knew the price but after our underwhelming food it was definitely not worth it.  Still in search of a favorite breakfast spot.

1st time here and I must say I had a fabulous experience! The customer service was OUTSTANDING! I got to sit wherever I felt comfortable in the table of my choice. My server was pleasant and greeted me rather quickly. I ordered the apple juice which reminded me of like an apple cider.....it was delicious. I did wait for a good amount of time for my food to arrive BUT fresh takes time. If you want quick processed food then go to Ihop! My pancakes were beautifully presented with strawberries and cream. I barely added syrup to them they were so yummy and fluffy! I also had scrambled eggs, pork sausage, and home fries which were fantastic. You can taste the freshness in every bite. As for the decor....it's very warm and inviting! I love the vintage tables and bright colors. Not to mention a local artist has displayed her art work on the walls for purchase! So depending on how often you visit......the place may have a different feel each time :) The owners are really taking notes and listening to what their patrons want, so TELL THEM! I will definitely be back to try some of the chef's recommendations. Glad to have you in my neighborhood!
Great food, service and environment. I would recommend this place to anyone! The staff is always so nice and helpful!

This was my second year in a row taking my son to have breakfast here for Mother's Day. The food is always great, and the young staff there are super sweet and attentive to me and my toddler. This is our new tradition and I would recommend this place to anyone!

Just try this morning with my husband.  Ordered vegetables omelet and eggs burrito not bad. They have big selection for breakfast and lunch. Prices are reasonable,  we will  come back to try the lunch  time. Nice art display and tables different shape . Clean and friendly staff. We only wait 12 minutes for our food.

Weird little place with mismatched furniture, and really good (but pricey) food. And $5 cups of coffee (that I admit, is very very good). 

Family owned. Quirky. I like it. Staff (owners) are super nice. yummy!

My husband and I love finding local restaurants and Divine Eatery may be the best one yet.  Today we had the fried pickles (almost a tempura style batter and somehow not surface of the sun temperature, impressive) for an appetizer.  My husband had the chicken fingers and really enjoyed them, I had the Divine BBQ burger and am happy to declare it one of my favorite burgers of my life.  Can't wait to come back for breakfast!!

don't be fooled by the unassuming decor of this sweet little cafe because the chef/owner spares no expense when it comes to the food! everything from the best coffee beans to the freshest meats are carefully selected and prepared by someone who loves and appreciates good food.. the biscuits and gravy made me want to lick the plate--i could tell the turkey and pork sausage i ate were so fresh, not possible they were ever frozen! loved that the potatoes weren't those shredded messy frozen things too, but big golden fried chunks of pure yummy. note: many small cafe serve cheap weak coffee to maximize on profits--not here--if you appreciate a seriously great cuppa, you will find it. wishing this new spot much success!

This place is definitely sub-par, at best. Esquivel served us and let me tell you, she's a BIG reason we won't be back. Her service is mediocre, she seemed bothered when we asked for salsa and the restroom. There was a small insect on the table that we had to remove. There is a small shelf in the corner with stickers and crayons for the kids, but in the mix of the papers there were a few unopened pieces of mail as if they live here (wouldn't doubt it). The sink is about 10 feet from the grill in the open kitchen area. The list goes on and on. The ONLY positive thing that I can say about this place is the bathroom is clean. I will not be returning, lesson learned.

Good local place in providence/northwest area. Staff if friendly and knowledgable of menu items. Paintings are nice and can be purchased. Business cards are hung under each painting. No freezer so everything is made fresh and from scratch. I purchased the meat lovers burrito. It's definitely a bonus that you can add egg whites without extra charge. Burrito was hot and fresh. Took a few bites without the salsa or black pepper and it was delicious. Ordered half stack of smores pancakes. So fluffy! Not too sweet and chocolate chips were baked into the stack. Definitely going there more!

This place has seriously impressed me... The food was super fresh... The waiter was on top of the entire room (seats only 45) 
The chef has passion... You see it watching him glide around the kitchen like an artist guides around a canvas... I not only will come back.. But will rave about this place... I will be bringing everyone I know here... 
I even love the mix matched tables and chairs... These guys have a regular in the making for sure

This place is pretty good. Big sized portions so it definitely fills you up! Service is okay, seems like the servers are more on the younger side, so their probably still learning the job. I had a cheese burger, son had grilled cheese and my boyfriend had the chili cheese fries, but unfortunately it seems like it would be something that I could cook myself. Overall I'd come again if I was in the area. The owner/chef was friendly and the food was good

Hit or miss. I've been twice.  I ordered basic bacon and eggs the first visit with a side of the strawberry pancakes. The pancakes definitely lived up to expectations - fluffy and well topped with berries and whipped cream. The second visit I ordered the eggs Benedict and didn't make it further than two bites. The spinach was way overcooked and everything tasted off. The potatoes were fine though. 

While I appreciate this is a restaurant where you can see and watch the cook working, additional cook staff would be great because we were there forever, and one of the times there were only 3 other tables occupied. Anyway, this place has potential but has room for improvement.

We used Uber Eats to try Divine Eatery for the first time. We ordered bagels with cream cheese and an order of pancakes. I was impressed that everything was still warm and the bagels were toasted nicely. My only complaint was that one of the three pancakes was totally burnt and we couldn't eat it. It shouldn't have been served. I would try them again if I was in the area because everything else was good.
Service was okay, the $4 coffee was pretty awful as were the benedicts. The hollandaise had zero flavor. Sadly wont be returning.

The service was excellent and the decor was cute and quirky. We went for breakfast. Our eggs and bacon and toast were all prepared the way we ordered them. 

Scrambled...not wet, but not rubbery! (Kudos to Divine Eatery on this note. Most places never get that right!)

My eggs were over medium and cooked exactly the way I like them. 

My husband's bacon was crispy but not burnt. Exactly how he ordered it. 

I rarely drink soda, but they have cherry coke on tap...yippee!

The one complaint I have, and it is a big one because it is the thing that really completes a hot breakfast...is that the breakfast potatoes were NOT GOOD. They were WAY TOO SALTY and I believe they came from a bag. They were tiny, dry, crispy squares, and totally inedible. 

I would give Divine Eatery 5 stars for a neighborhood cafe if they would go the extra mile and make homemade home fries.

Part wicked, part divine, Divine Eatery will certainly pave its way into becoming one of my weekly restaurant  haunts. Being the curious person that I am, I came across Divine Eatery while under construction and stuck my head in. Chef Esther welcomed me inside, amidst the construction, and offered me a tour of the new casual restaurant she's creating here in Centennial Hills. The menu (while not finalized at the time of my visit) boasts true quality, focusing on all natural, preservative-free, fresh and healthy ingredients. In addition to the tour, Chef Esther was kind enough to provide me with a taste test of their BLT and their Veggie Burger. The bread used for both were superb, and sourced locally! The BLT was served on a toasted whole grain, while the Veggie Burger was served on an perfectly airy sesame bun. Chef let me know that the menu will also feature items served on a brioche bun, for the richer, "wicked" offerings... yum! Now being from Texas, I prefer meat over veggies, so naturally I thought the BLT would take the cake in a comparison test - [Now Insert Foot In Mouth]. If there's anything I learned from Chef Esther, it's never to doubt the power of a Veggie Burger. Long story short, when you pair roasted assorted veggies topped with fresh mozzarella, caramelized red onions and a balsamic reduction, you've just convinced this meat eater that this Veggie Burger is taking home the top prize!

There's plenty to get excited about Divine Eatery. I'm excited to come back after their up and running to experience the restaurant as a whole! While construction completion dates are always iffy, I'm crossing my fingers that Divine Eatery opens on their estimated date of Sunday, August 25.  

**Gluten-Free/Celiac? Chef Esther has you covered! Several gluten-free options will be incorporated into Divine Eatery's final menu!

Decor critiques are spot on- the blue flooring with sparkles reminds me of my garage.  My wife commented on the bare walls.

Only 1 coffee choice- American- ie, black coffee.  Also, since it's special, it's $4.  I don't think any monkeys ate and then pooped out the beans, though.

The food- the omelette was awesome.  Done nicely!

Will this place make it?  Don't know, unfortunately.  I'd love for this to be my local breakfast spot that's within walking distance.  There are 3 other breakfast spots in Centennial Hills that have more ambiance, a more interesting menu, and cheaper prices.  Yikes!  Also, not a fan of the planted reviews (see Kate B).  Hence, the one star review to more accurately reflect the restaurant.

Being seasonal residents from the Midwest - I'm not fond of the term "snowbird" - we like to go out to different places on Sunday mornings for breakfast or brunch to familiarize ourselves with what is available in the area.  On the strength of positive Yelp results we found this place.  Although we didn't have anything out of the ordinary, the food was delicious.  My wife's chicken fried steak measured up to everything she would expect, coming as we are from the home of fried food covered in gravy.  The ambiance was quaint with its home grown art and mismatched furniture.  It's sort of clashed with the modern strip mall building, but otherwise was charming.  

Business was brisk but it wasn't crowded like a lot of breakfast places are so if you find long lines at your favorite place this is a good place to consider.  I would have given it another star, but when we arrived there was only one employee doing it all.  He did a pretty good job of taking care of everybody, and eventually more help arrived.  But they could have had a better schedule the day we went.  

This is a good place to try.

This is in our neighborhood and we've been wanting to try it. Inside it's quaint and colorful. The food was excellent! The pulled pork sandwich was tender and not smothered in sauce. You could taste the pork. It had onion straws and coleslaw on top of the pork. I usually ask to remove it but this time I thought I'd try it. Never again will I ask to remove it! My husband had the BBQ burger and loved the fact the fact the meat was equal size to the large bun. We are going back for breakfast, I have to try the s'more pancakes. The chef and staff are very friendly. I think what made me love it is the chef is local and has family working with her. It defiantly has mom's touch!

This is my 3rd time  here  and let me tell you , it's fantastic . Food is delicious , we order  the breakfast burrito and was the perfect size not to big not to small . When you live this place you leave satisfied
The staff is friendly and they make sure you don't run empty on anything you might need .

This is seriously some of the best breakfast food I have ever had. The menu is extensive and it was hard to choose. We took Javier's recommendations so  I had the Throwback with egg whites, turkey bacon, and french toast. My husband had the Country Benedict. I also had some fancy decaf coffee that was soooo delicious. We will definitely come back next time we're in town. The service was excellent and the food divine;)

Love this place! Local cafe with great food and coffee. 

But I'm dropping my rating down some. There are two waitstaff that are young and inattentive. They forget things you ask for. They leave dirty dishes on the table. They place hot plates down in front of reaching kids. When the place fills up its like they can't seem to concentrate. It's gotten to the point that if we see these two working without the owners there then we skip eating there.

Such a great neighborhood breakfast spot. The place is not huge, but a cozy place. 

We walked in with one waiter serving the whole place and few other tables filled up right behind us. I give the guy major props because he handled the situation like a pro. He was very gracious and got us taken care of well.

The kids had the chocolate chip pancakes. My hubby had the bacon egg sandwich. I ordered the Throwback. My MIL had the plain French toast. We all loved our chosen dishes. 

We will definitely come back. I really wanna try their Benedict options. I am thrilled to find a new breakfast spot different from the franchise places.
Love the menu.  Food is excellent and service is quick.  Not fancy but damn good.  I had the country benedict, sausage, eggs and country gravy.  Love it.

I haven't been here since chef Esther sold it almost a year ago so I was very apprehensive but was too tired to go somewhere else. I got a cheeseburger and fries to go today and everything is still delicious!  My order was ready when they said it would be and everything was done right. 
I gave a 4 out of 5 stars though because it is $13 -- a little steep and I would have left without the ranch dressing I ordered had I not checked.   
I'll be back more frequently now.
Very good food and friendly service.  The portions were just right and tasty.  Was very pleased to find that the restrooms have a baby changing table!
Great food! Great service! Country fried steak was the best I ever had! Crispy & juicy with real sausage gravy. Portions as large as the plate. Love it here!

This place was just ok for me.  The pancakes were very fluffy and light, which was nice.  I ordered the cornflake french toast with berries, which was very good. But I have had the crazy good waffles from Stacks and Yokes, which was better.  I think Baby Stacks is better for my taste as they have more rich sauces that go on the pancakes. I will probably not come back here.  The decor was weird as well.
The mystery remains. Came on a Tuesday around noon and they were closed. Maybe call ahead of time? I don't know their circumstance so I'm not mad but it was a bummer.

I've been to this Cafe a few times and have been kindly greeted with great service every time. They are kid friendly and were always attentive. 

The first time I ordered the buffalo wrap and the chicken fingers and fries for my kids. They were both delicious! I appreciate that this place uses REAL food and everything is made from scratch and doesn't come out of a freezer. 

We went for breakfast another time and ordered pancakes with sausage on the side. I had the smores pancakes and my husband had the divine pancakes. Both were delicious and very filling. I couldn't finish the full order. Next time I'll do the half. 

The only complaint I have is the prices. Not exactly family friendly prices. However because they are actually serving real food from scratch I can see why it's pricier than most places. I suggest getting the Epoxy app where you can use a "punch card" for them and if you refer others using the app to try them out (and they do) you get $5 off your order using the app.

Food here is excellent. Service is very sub par. Very unfortunate since I really do enjoy the food here and it is one mile from my house. When my family and I come in it takes 10 minutes to get a menu, another 15 to put our order in, and another 20 to get our food. Never mind if you want a refill on your coffee. You're better off running to the nearest Starbucks which is 5 miles away(maybe if you're lucky your food will be ready by the time you get back). I am always very reluctant to give a poor yelp review but I am hoping the owner sees it and makes changes to the staff in order for customers to get better service. I've been here numerous times with my family for breakfast and you would think they would recognize and give me a little better service. My friends who dine here also feel the same way. Lucky for divine eatery the food is good because if you combined sub par food with sub par service it spells disaster for a small business.

I must say that we were very impressed with everything we got that morning.  We went on a Sunday morning and it was already crowded.  We only had to wait 5 minutes which was okay with us.  We got there just in time, because the wait for up to 30-40 minutes.  

The divine pancakes we one of the best we had. So fluffy and flavorful. No syrup needed in my opinion. 

The biscuit sandwich was a perfect pairing of turkey sausage, egg, and grape jam with a soft biscuit.  Amazing.  

Veggie burrito with egg whites was satisfying.  Seasoned well. 

Country fried steak was super flavorful and crunchy.  

I suggest you try this place out yourself.  You will not be disappointed.

This place has won my heart over and over again. Never seems to let me down.  The Fonte coffee they serve is delicious.  Everything on the menu is flavorful. Every time I've visited I have had something new, and everything has been nothing less then impressive. Definitely has become top of the list.

We tried Divine Eatery on the spur of the moment (and other Yelp! reviews) and are glad we did. My wife ordered the Divine Salad, which she reported as delicious and interesting, and we shared the Meat Lover's Breakfast Burrito and a short order of the Un-Red Velvet Pancakes.  it was definitely enough for two. The burrito was meaty, as advertised, but not too salty, and full of other flavors, including crispy fried potatoes which tasted like they would make a worthy side dish. The light, flavorful chocolate pancakes with cream cheese frosting and chocolate chips were worth a trip all by themselves, especially in company with the robust hot coffee. Not fancy and not cheap, but they offer a 10% discount for teachers, military, and seniors. We'll be back.

I had the small Frosted Flake French Toast and a side of scrambled egg with cheese. The French toast really was amazing, and I could eat it often! Good thing I live close!

I was expecting the prices to be a bit more affordable, but I didn't mind the price since everything was quality. 

The staff (including the chef) was very friendly.  Their service gave it that small neighborhood cafe feel! 

I'll be back...and maybe even tomorrow!

We love Divine Eatery. My husband and I come here almost every Saturday morning. My husband favorites the Divine Biscuits and Gravy, and I go between the Chili Omelet and Red Velvet Pancakes. Everyone here is super attentive, and are more than willing to help you with any questions you may have! I hope this place is here to stay. We need a cafe like this on this side of town.
Great food and great service. The decor is a little rough but it's quickly forgotten when the food arrives!

Came here to start our day on my parents' side of town. 
I liked the wait staff a lot - friendly from the start. Cute setting, and the food was good too. 
The boyfriend had their patty melt, and I had the South of the Border skillet. It was pretty much chorizo on potatoes with eggs and cheese. Always a good menu option. 
I honestly enjoyed the service more. It's the kinda place that I'd go to if I was on that side of town.

We just tried this place for the first time. We ordered the chilaquilles, smoked salmon bagel, and the s'mores pancakes. The order was to go and the service was quick for that. The food was delicious. The pork in the chilaquilles had a nice flavor and didn't taste old or reheated like it often does at most places. The dish was spicy, but SO good. My daughter loved her pancakes and the bagel was pretty and tasted great too. We used a Groupon without My problems. So glad we found this place, as we will be returning for some more yummy eats!
My wife and I loved Divine Eatery. Great food and excellent customer service! This is definitely our new breakfast spot. 5 stars!
I've been coming here since the place opened. Met the original chef, who's since been on the Food network. I love this place! Great coffee, great prices, great food, and right down the street. 10/10
Such a cute little spot! The food is fresh and flavorful, and not to mention they have REAL french fries. So yummy!

For a little hole-in-the-wall place they have big flavors. When they say "garlic chips" they aren't kidding around! As a LOVER of garlic, I am often disappointed in things with "garlic" in the name. Not so here. The garlic fries that came with my burger were excellent. The garlic chips I got as an appetizer were excellent. The whole place had that wonderful smell of sautéed garlic when we first walked in. My dad ordered the wings, and they were pretty good. My burger was cooked and seasoned well. Prices were right where I would expect them to be. 

All in all, a great place. Every time I'm in the neighborhood I'll give this place a visit.

I have been to Divine Eatery (DE), multiple times. I have put off review, after review, waiting for something magical to happen.  After approximately five visits, I felt it was time to document.  

DE...is as the crow flies...just short of mile from the domicile. A residence that I have inhabited for almost half a decade.  Maybe there should be be more check-in's.....I don't know.

On the most recent visit, I met the GF as she was coming off shift for some breakfast.  The DE was what was decided upon.

I arrived first and found not much happening on a beautiful, unseasonably warm Saturday morning.  Many a table option to choose from.  I sat and sipped on my coffee and water waiting for the GF.

Looking at the menu I decided on the "Chilaquiles" which consists of 
"Freshly deep fried corn tortillas, slow roasted pulled pork and smothered with salsa verde then topped with 2 eggs, queso fresco and chive sour cream" (Retrieved from https://www.grubhub.com/restaurant/divine-eatery-7181-n-hualapai-wy-115-las-vegas/348582?gclid=EAIaIQobChMIu7TA1fWN2QIVT2x-Ch1u2Qt5EAAYASAAEgKRYPD_BwE&utm_source=google&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=Las%2BVegas%2C%2BNV%2B%7C%2BLas%2BVegas%2C%2BNV%2B%7C%2BRestaurants&utm_term=%2Bdivine%20%2Beatery%20%2Bmenu&efkwid=274867955246&ef_id=WnfbGQAAAAF-rBOV%3A20180205041916%3A).  Wow!! I was not expecting that URL!  When it arrived the chips were for the most part....soggy.

I also ordered up some linked sausage and an a half order of "Funky Monkey."  It's French Toast with a peanut butter whipping cream and a sugar torched banana thrown on top.  Hell!  It was a cheat day!

The chow was three stars as was the service.  I thought whole thing could have been maybe a four....but when your coffee cup runneth empty, and there is not happening in the restaurant and it sits there for what seems FOREVER...and nothing happens, a breakfast joint is gonna loose a star.

Given where DE sits in the brain housing group after all the experience....I give it....three stars.  Thank you.

My mother and I have been going to this place every weekend. We're creatures of habit and get the same thing each week. Our obsession is the chilaquiles. The staff is friendly and the restaurant itself is always clean.
Best breakfast in Vegas! The divine pancakes are so fluffy and the French toast is amazing. I suggest the Nutty! The homemade potato chips are great too!

Terrible!!!!! One 1 of the worst place I've ever eaten at!!!!!!
who Fry's a turkey burger with lettuce???????

We love the food every time we come for breakfast. I've ordered the omelette and it was great. Breakfast b potatoes are awesome. Best so far is Eggs Beni and French toast. Cook and waitress and very friendly and finally glad to have something close enough to walk to.
Great breakfast, always a pleasure to eat here. Prices are great to and a great atmosphere!

We're always on the lookout for good "mom & pop" restaurants, and we were fortunate to stumble across this little gem.  My family went here for lunch, and loved it.  I had the cheeseburger sliders, which were great, and cooked exactly how I wanted. My wife was in heaven, since she was able to order a patty melt medium-rare, and it was actually cooked correctly (she gets very irritated at restaurants that refuse to go any lower than medium). The fries were awesome since they were hand-cut and cooked fresh with a dash of seasoning.

The decor isn't anything fancy, which seemed intentional.  Every table and chair was different, giving the place a very relaxed, down-to-earth vibe.  The wait staff was prompt and friendly, and made sure my drink never got empty.

I look forward to going back.

I'm very sad because this used to be my favorite restaurant. They MUST have new owners or something? Everything is just going downhill and I believe they'll be going out of business soon. The ONLY thing that's good is the customer service.

However, the steak Benedict is no longer on the menu? That was the best thing. And they kept selling out of it beforehand. You had to come early to get it. It was a hot item & now they took it away? Makes no sense.

The menu is VERY inconsistent and the food is ALWAYS inconsistent.

This is the SECOND time coming where we ordered the food, and then 10 minutes later, they come back and say they don't have the food item? So we have to re-order. That is absolutely unacceptable. Not one but TWO times.... in a row!!!!! 

KNOW YOUR MENU. Know what you have and what you don't have before you seat customers. Warn them that something is sold out!

I kept coming back to see if they would make better changes but unfortunately I believe this will be my last time at this restaurant.

About the food:

My potatoes were not even seasoned! Not even with salt or pepper.
My omelet order came wrong the first time and they had to re-make it.
The chorizo burrito was good... but really dry.
The pancakes tasted like "add water" pancakes. No flavor. 
The chili was mushy and needed seasoning.

Awesome breakfast!!! I ordered the sausage gravy biscuits and eggs. Some of THE best sausage gravy I've had!!!!! My husband got the strawberry pancakes, eggs, and bacon --- the homemade whipped cream -- OMG!!!! Both dishes DELISH and the service was warm and friendly!!! We'll be back to try lunch some other time!
Exiting Vegas thus is a great stop off. Food was really fresh and tasty and the coffee was really strong and tasted great. Price was really good too.
Cute little spot. Had the biscuits and gravy and the gravy was pretty good. The service was fast and friendly. I would recommend this place!

Good service, good food, quaint, clean and nice interior.. and they asked me if I'd like my coffee in a to-go cup at the end.

No complaints, and I'll definitely be back.

A little pricey for a neighborhood spot, but happy to have a cute cafe/restaurant in Providence! We had the BBQ burger and patty melt (each came with fries) and both were delicious. We usually take out, but the cafe has a cute and cozy atmosphere and would totally eat in for a lunch date. Can't wait to try the breakfast!

Awesome place! Had the Chilaquilles. Divine. And huge. Bring your appetite. I had trouble choosing from the menu. So many items sounded great. Will be back to try others while I'm in town. TRY THIS PLACE!

Hubby and I frequent here on our Saturday morning breakfast dates. We usually are lucky and come right before the rush, but beware the place is not very big and can get backed up. The guys are awesome and know our drink orders when we come in hubby gets the extra strong coffee if you're into that sort of thing. Try the French Toast. Bomb.com. the potatoes are good, but they don't have hashbrowns.

New business...they have a lot to learn. I ordered the egg white healthy omelet. The person cooking is not familiar to cooking with egg whites. What came to the table was a tasteless mess. Could have do e better cooking at home. We also ordered the French Toast which was good.

What a disappointing breakfast experience. From the moment we walked in I disliked the decor. The bus girls dismal lack of knowledge of even the drinks available and even worse our severs lack of any timing whatsoever was of no help. Drinks were never refilled, who has one coffee? Had to ask for flatware The dishes came out one at a time about 5 minutes apart. 
The bacon was overdone and of very poor quality, like the cheapest bacon at the grocery store. 
The unred velvet pancakes probably the best of our dishes but too sweet for my tastes. 
The biscuits and gravy was very meh.. The biscuits sweet doughy and not flaky at all. Tasted under cooked. The gravy was so so nothing wrong but nothing special. The chiliquiles with pork were just a mess no salsa and dry chips and the pork was flavorless and seemed to have been prepared in either a slow cooker or pressure cooker either way not good. The frosted flake French toast was ok but again nothing special. The bread choice was not good, too thin and not enough mouthfeel. 
Good berries. 
Will not be returning. For some reason it was very busy so I'm sure they will do fine without my dollars.

Best Benedict's in town! 

Wife has the Original and I have the Country. Very filling and always terrific service. A hidden gem on this side of town.

We went here for the first time today and it was a disaster. For some reason they only had one cook working on a Saturday morning?? The whole restaurant was full and this poor guy was cooking for everyone, including to-go orders!! It's no wonder our food took a very long time and arrived cold. We weren't even upset about our food, and the service was friendly and fast. My heart goes out to that poor cook who probably had the worst New Year's Eve of his life!

The coffee was $4! Just plain regular coffee. I really wanted to try the red velvet pancakes so I ordered the throwback breakfast which is just 2 eggs, bacon or sausage, potatoes and their regular pancakes. You can substitute the red velvet pancakes or their nutty french toast for an extra dollar. The throwback breakfast is $10 which to me is extremely over priced for your basic breakfast fare. And there is not much to say about the food it was just eggs bacon and some unseasoned potatoes. I could make it better at home.  The best part was the red velvet pancakes they were really tasty and had a good cream cheese icing on them. I would go back for those alone. The decor was weird as others have said. The servers were friendly though. I like to support local businesses but not when I break the bank eating there! For my partner and I the bill was over $30 for 2 basic breakfasts. I can't afford to go back. My wallet and stomach won't let me.
Taste great, good staff, good coffee, very laid back place to have a good meal for the locals

This placed sucked I got their biggest hamburger on the menu and the patties are the size or McDonald's cheeseburgers I got ripped off Two adult meals and a baby meal for 40 bucks. My son couldn't even eat that baby cheeseburger because it was so hard I advise not coming here.

My husband and I have been here quite a few times and every time is always wonderful! I love that I can seat myself because we usually end up at the same table every time. The staff is always friendly and says hi or good morning when we come in. We usually come for breakfast so I've never had lunch there, but their breakfast is always delicious. It's a great little spot to have so close to my neighborhood.

Started coming here since it opened. Love the service. They are very friendly to us, speak to my children, and even remember our orders. I agree with the other reviews that it is a bit pricey. You can tell that the food is very homemade and not store bought so I assume that is the reason. Despite the price I enjoy the atmosphere and quality of food which makes it worth it to me to continue to visit regularly. It's my go to breakfast place
I like this place a lot and its comfortable atmosphere and the food and portion is good

I thought I'd give this place a try after seeing it advertised in the paper. I wish the negative reviews had been wrong. The waiter got our order wrong, but he was in training and there was a language barrier. When I tried to explain what was missing from my order he didn't understand the difference between toast and French Toast. After that correction, I was still missing items from my order. My girlfriend received regular eggs instead of the egg whites she requested twice. I was really disappointed in his fellow food server as she didn't help him at all. I wish this hadn't been my first experience.

We ordered take out from this place for breakfast, it was pretty good.  Not super memorable but I will definitely be back just because it is close and wasn't bad.  I had the eggs Benedict, I'd say they were average...the who experience was just that, average.
Great breakfast , pancakes so large and good.  I want to go back for the lunch menu.

always happy when new joints open up in our neck o the woods and even happier to support small local businesses, i was thrilled to see that an eatery was opening so close to home.
this little locals cafe is just one big square room with tables, chairs and a completely open kitchen, which i find delightful because it just makes you feel like you're having a home cooked meal at a friend's house.
all of the furniture is mismatched, which i also find delightful but i'm sure it was unintentional as opening a restaurant is expensive so they saved on the furniture and spent most of their budget on more important things like good kitchen equipment.
whether intentional or not, i absolutely love the warm, inviting, comforting feel of the place with all of its fun and quirky furniture.

the first time i dined here was for breakfast in the afternoon with the hubby.
i'm of the mindset that breakfast can and should be eaten any time during the day.
chef esther greeted us and right away i had the feeling that i was about to enjoy an extremely comforting meal.
i had a stack of buttermilk pancakes and a veggie omelet.
both were prepared perfectly, i haven't a single complaint.
i was so satisfied with my meal and the service that i couldn't wait to go back.

we ordered take out a few times after that.

on our second visit, we arrived about 15 minutes prior to closing and chef esther welcomed us just as warmly as the first time AND she remembered us which was really pleasant.
we didn't want to keep her too long so we took a quick look at the menu (which had improved significantly since our first visit) and ordered.
i ordered the eggs benedict and, of course, she was out of hollandaise.
then, to my surprise, she said she'd whip some up just for my order.
WHAT!?
if anybody has any clue, hollandaise sauce is one of those mother sauces in french cooking that people hate to make because it is so precise and can break very easily.
so, i told her no but she insisted.
again, WHAT!?
as she began to make the 4 meals that the 3 of us ordered, she was also making my hollandaise.
i must admit that i had my doubts about her ability to do all of these things simultaneously.
but, to my delight, our food came out within a few minutes of ordering all at the same time and my hollandaise was perfect!
as we ate our delicious food, we all had a little giggle with chef esther as she told us the story of the first time she had to make hollandaise in culinary school.
yes, folks, she is a classically trained chef so...eat that.  =)

i've since been back many times and have enjoyed every bite.
the food here is most definitely made with love and care, never too salty, never underseasoned, always cooked to your exact preference.
there are understandably minor kinks to be worked out, as with any new small business, but certainly nothing that would prevent me from returning time and again.
it's easy to see that chef esther is working her tail off to make it a comfortable and inviting spot for all of us here in northlandia.
i'm happy as a clam to have divine eatery in our neighborhood and welcome chef esther with open arms.

Food was okay, nothing crazy special. It isn't a bad environment, however when you're the only one in the place and the chef and waiter just stare in your direction, it makes it kind of awkward. They didn't have anything else to do, so I understand a little...but still.

This is a cute little place that's hard to find. I ordered the red velvet pancakes which are not red velvet, more like chocolate. I would recommend the California omelette with egg whites minus the spinach.
Great breakfast spot!! No wait & great food. Had the throw back w pumpkin pancakes . Pancakes were soooo good and didn't need syrup. Fast service & great staff.  Just wish they had mimosa's.

Nice little breakfast/lunch spot way out in no mans lands or least feels like it finding the place for the first time. I think this little (think only five businesses in the complex) business complex only thing in the area. Not from lack of homes in the area but if not living in the area not sure if want make long drive. The food overall more like solid three stars but the service was without doubt five star in my mind. 

The food I ordered "The Skinny Skillet" was interesting take on skillet. I was thinking of maybe more traditional in casket iron skillet serve it in or even cook it in. They cook everything in separate pan and then put everything on the plate. I love the nice thick cuts of potatoes! They keep some of the skin on the potato. Just the hearty mixture between the turkey burger, sun dried tomato, and feta cheese. In every bite can get mixture or pick and choose. Top it off with fried egg (you can have the egg cook any style you want) my favorite things and anything tastes better with fried egg. You get some of that running cream egg yolk mixed in with everything. Good stuff!!! The plate is totally packed so there no cheating you out of your meal for the price. 

The "Unred" Velvet pancakes that was another interesting take on classic. i shared the pancakes with Suzy H. Yelpers need do our due diligence check out as much things on the menu for the first time! Maybe just stuck on traditional style. The fact that take out the red food coloring had my brain thinking is this trick. It looks more like chocolate pancake and that the first taste came to mind. The pancake not as fully but more dense. Not bad pancake at all. Just something never did much for me overall. If order pancakes again here would go try the other options on the menu.

The service that something that needs to be recognize! The gentlemen serving us was fabulous. The chef or she might be owner came out later checking up on not just us but two other tables dining at the same time. Both super friendly, attentive to details, and great peeps talk stories too! The gentlemen even offer if wanted take waters or coffee to go with us. Not often you hear your wait staff say that as your about to leave. Or the fact for the kids menu they serve capri sun juice as a drink option. I like the interior have local artists original artwork on the walls. If you want can purchase. The artwork fits with the restaurant. The only downfall is the location. If the food was more wow factor would make the drive. Really one of those that if am in the area would come back again. You never say never in life.
Best breakfast place up in the Northwest it's hidden within providence. The meals are very homey and you can taste the freshness in everything.

You get what you pay for and it was definitely worth it! I would highly recommend this place! The owner even came out to each table to talk. Service was great and friendly. They also have a military discount: )

I'm giving this place 5 stars because everything was perfect. I felt like I was at home eating here. Staff is very friendly and nice. Pancakes are nice and fluffy with fresh homemade whip cream and fresh strawberries. Home fries were fresh. Left filling full and fluffy!!

I'd give it 3.5* if I could.  Been meaning to try this place for a while and finally got the chance for breakfast.  It was ok.  Food was decent, but nothing special.  I would go back if I was nearby at the right time and some of the lunch stuff on the menu sounded good.  Pancakes were good, with strawberries and whipped cream.  Home fries were fine, just simple fried potato hunks with some salt and pepper.  Toast was a little burnt.  Juice was at least Simply Orange, so not concentrate, but not fresh squeezed for $4?  Nothing incredible, but not bad either.

Not a terrible spot.
The biscuits and gravy were good, fluffy fresh biscuits with a decent gravy.
The thing I liked about the chili cheese fries was that the chili was REAL. None of that canned crap.
Would be willing to come back and try something else on the menu.

Located very far northwest, this small eatery offers short wait times unlike other area breakfast places, especially on a Sunday. I got the divine pancakes and my husband got the biscuits and gravy. Both were great. The orange juice is expensive considering it's Simply Orange and $4, so I paid for a gallon. -_- with no free refills... Still the tap water is vegas tap water, I'd recommend just bringing your own starbucks.

So this is my 2nd time here.. First time I got lunch and it was delicious. Today I got breakfast.. Also delicious. Only problem wAs food took 30 min to come out and the staff seemed to be upset when I politely asked how much longer it would be since I have to go to work. I believe the chef is also the owner.. She's back there doing everything from scratch by herself... Great food!!

Best biscuits and gravy that I have had in town! And the pumpkin pancakes were also amazing. Nice and fluffy, and very flavorful. I highly recommend this place. I very seldom write reviews for any place, but this is well worth a mention. Especially for those who live in the centennial area.

We have been coming here for months now and have never had a bad experience! Whether it's breakfast lunch or dinner everything is amazing! The best little place on the block it's heavenly and devilish at the same time. Ester is an amazing chef, the service is outstanding, a pure delight

I've ordered from here though Uber eats, I like the chorizo burrito and chocolate pancakes. I've tried all the other pancakes, don't waste your time. The salsa that comes with the burrito taste like a not so great store bought salsa. It's decent food when you don't want to go out because of the delivery option but not my first choice if I choose to go out for breakfast.
Love this place! They always offer their "strong" coffee and like it. Great, diverse menu!

Divine Eatery is a fun little place to grab a bite if you're in the mood for cute, quirky, and easy.  We stopped by in mid-afternoon after a morning at the nearby Knickerbocker Park.  We had to be careful, though, because the operating hours are a bit wonky on the weekend (i.e. closed from 2:00-5:00 p.m.).

The menu is surprisingly large for such a small outfit, and it's great that breakfast is served all day.  My twins also appreciated the yummy choices on the Kids' Menu.  It's a tad on the pricey side, but not outrageous.  The quality of food and service was great.

The eating space is small, and cramped.  If it gets too busy, it gets extra stuffy and noisy, but that's to be expected.  It's also a bit awkward to have the kitchen so exposed.  I don't like listening to the cook barking out orders to the kitchen staff.  I was also a little put off by items being thrown across the kitchen.  The cook would call out for pulled pork, and someone would retrieve it from a cooler and hail mary it across all of 4 feet.  Nothing outright wrong per se, but just awkward I guess.

I think it's worth giving it a shot, but we're not chomping at the bit to get back anytime soon.

The only reason it gets 2 stars is because my husband was able to eat his breakfast, but the majority of his was pre-made so it wasn't too difficult to bomb on biscuits & gravy. My breakfast on the other hand...... not edible. I ordered a bacon & cheese omelette and sourdough toast. The omelette was still raw! I cut into it & it looked like I had just broken the eggs myself. It was still liquid inside. Of course by this time, I lost my appetite. FYI...... if you go here, you have to butter your own toast and the butter packets are hidden under the liner paper in the basket. You won't know this, because nobody tells you! When I complained the omelette was still liquid, I was offered "sorry" by the waitress. She never told the 4 cooks in the kitchen or offered to adjust the bill, she stated "sorry" multiple times.  If you want subpar food and a chance of food poisoning, go here!

We went there for breakfast over the weekend.  The service was poor and we had to wait 15 minutes to place our order.  There were only two other tables of customers in the restaurants.  The food had absolutely no taste to it.  I ordered the Scrambled Eggs/Sausage Gravy & Biscuits combo.  The biscuits were definitely Pillsbury biscuits that you buy in the grocery store. The potatoes had been warmed up in the microwave and looked petrified. The eggs were no better.  They claim to use natural ingredients but the food had NO TASTE OR FLAVOR!!  I would not recommend to anyone and we will not be going back.

I work part time for Uber Eats delivering orders and I have to say the orders I pick up smell awesome. So awesome that after my second pick up I went back and order food myself. I ordered my taster food which was a Caesar salad and they didn't let me down, it was on point!!!

I so wanted to love this place. Atmosphere was nice and homey, the waitress was very nice and attentive. Food came out quickly, presentation was nice. I had the veggie benny.. The seasoned potatoes were delicious! I really enjoyed my Benedict until I found egg shells in my food. Sadly, it ruined my entire meal and I lost my appetite. Good little breakfast spot, I didn't experience anything extraordinary. 
The iced green tea is sweetened which threw me off as well. I expected regular green tea when I ordered it. The people are great and the food is good. I may give them another try someday.

I have no clue how this place has even received any stars. Decided to try this place out today on our way back into town. Sat for 15 minutes before even being acknowledged and there were only 2 other couples in there. My husband ordered the biggest burger on the menu and the kid who took the order didn't Ask how he wanted it cooked. I ordered my son the kids cheeseburger and myself the tuna melt. When the food came the fries were soggy from too much oil. My husbands burger was the size of a McDonald's cheeseburger patty not quarter pound patties like they said. My sons cheeseburger was so hard he only ate the bun. My tuna melt was horribly soggy and way tuna overload. When we got the check that was the icing on the cake, $40 for this so called food. My coffee was $3.95!!! Ridiculous. I have no idea how this place can be considered good. I would not waste your time!! Gross gross gross.

Went there today for lunch. I had the BYO burger with jalapeños and cheese, my daughters had the chorizo burrito and the kids burger. Everything was fresh, thanks to the awesome job by the chef, and tasty. I will definitely be back as the prices were very reasonable and the service and attitude were great.

I've eaten here twice, the first time was several months ago, the food was good so we decided this morning to go back. 
When we walked in the door, first we were not even greeted, or acknowledged in any way. We waited for a while about 10 minutes before we were seated. Fine, it's busy I get it. However, after we were sat, it took the server another 10 minutes or so to come to the table. We order our drinks and food, and the kid who sat us brings over the diet cokes....if he was going to bring them anyways why not ask for our drink order from the beginning, avoiding the long wait for the server. 
In any case our food took over an hour to arrive. I ordered a skirt steak sandwich and my friend had ordered a patty melt. She said her food was good, and mine was good for the most part, aside from the "grilled tomatoes" actually just being tomatoes that got hot from being on the sandwich...gross. 
We had waited too long, and we were far too hungry to send the food back for the grilled tomatoes, so I just picked off the tomatoes, although the table next to me did complain about theirs. 
When the young man came by to give a refill, he asked that I remove the straw from the cup because he was going to take the old glass and refill it so he wouldn't "waste any more cups." What? First of all, it's a health code violation to take a dirty cup from the table and refill and bring back to the table. Secondly, if he was going to do that, fine whatever but just give me a new straw then. Why leave me sitting there holding a straw? It was ridiculous.  Also, this same young man had gone and asked a table of guests if they had any advil? 
Service was sub par, from both the young man (busser/host/server assistant?) and the actual server. She was not very friendly, but who can blame her? SHE WAS THE ONLY SERVER in a restaurant where every single table was full. She was busy and clearly overwhelmed. After I paid the check, I needed it broken down, so I could leave a proper tip. Apparently, the owner was running the cash drawer, as the restaurant was running in chaos. When I asked her why there was only one server for Sunday Brunch, she very rudely told me that they're a small business, it's hard to get help. I said we had waited over an hour for the food and she said we can go somewhere else. 
Lol, okay thanks! Won't be back, good food isn't worth the rude owner, and strange antics.

This place ended up being gem hidden in the middle of a residential area. The menu is big enough to appeal to just about everyone, but not too long to overwhelm. I ordered takeout, and the smell of the food on the way back was a massive tease. When I finally reach my destination and was able to try the food, I was so impressed. I never would have imagined a tiny restaurant hidden away could taste so good. Way later in the night I ate leftovers from here. They tasted just as good as when they were freshly made. I will definitely be back.

I have been looking for a breakfast and lunch joint for a while beside the standard Dennys and IHOP. This place is great if your looking for a change from the commercial spots such as the former mentions. This place doesn't make the regular tasting french toast either. Im a huge fan of french toast is this is by far the best french toast I've had. Good spot to eat and good customer.

Perfekter Start in den Tag! Leckerer heißer Kaffee und schmackhafte Erdnussbutter-Bananen-French-Toasts. Der Service war gut und sehr zuvorkommend. Nett ist auch das Ambiente mit vielen verschiedenen kleinen Holztischen und Stühlen. Gerne wieder! :-)

First of all, $4 for a cup of store bought coffee that wasn't even hot by the time it got to us? Really? If that wasn't enough we both ordered the divine breakfast and not to sound corny but it was far less than divine. The eggs were cold, the potatoes were shriveled up (clearly just reheated), the sausage was undercooked and had a super weird taste to it and the toast came to the table in a basket untoasted, cold and stale. I took a few bites of each item and left the rest. I haven't been tempted to leave without paying in a long time because that's not the type of person I am but I was very close today. Sucks that I had such a disappointing experience here, I was hoping this would become my go-to breakfast place but.... The search continues
Great home style breakfast. Not too greasy and tasted fresh. The service was good and the staff was friendly.

This place is a little hidden- hard to find. Past by it 3 times before we spotted it. Actually on the corner of Hualapai and Elkhorn and the front only has "Café" marking the spot. 
The whole restaurant is open and it connects into the kitchen where you can interact with the chef and watch her prepare your divine meal. The menu has some great breakfast and lunch choices and all the food is made fresh to order.

The food overall was very good and it will be a nice place to frequent for a hot breakfast. We ordered the Chorizo breakfast burrito and the biscuits and gravy with a side of bacon. Everything was "Divine" and we finished our plates. 
(I would skip the orange juice though- tasted like minute maid. A nice touch would to have fresh squeezed juice.)

Small, quaint, cute place. The tables are different dinning tables like they shopped at yard sales or something, cute. Paintings on the wall are for sale. Just a small, family owned place. 
The good: food is really good. They will adjust menu choices a bit, especially since I'm gluten free and need to cut bread from my diet. They have a variety of egg dish choices that are good, I often will piece two together as I like different ingredients from two of their choices. 

Before I discovered (thanks doc)  I was gluten sensitive I had their Frosted Flakes French Toast, I have to say very tasty, unique, but good. A little sweet,especially with syrup, so if you don't like super sweet, don't go for it. 

The not so good: service - the people are fantastic, let me say that..they are slow though. So if you go be prepared to sit back and relax, don't go if you are in a hurry or really hungry (mistake I've made).

But the food always comes out made to order and piping hot!

Pancakes are yummy and fluffy, biscuits were tasty. I'm not a gravy fan, but I liked the gravy on my hubby's breakfast quite a bit. Eggs were cooked well, both scrambled and over easy. My 17-month-old devoured pancakes, eggs and potatoes and was sad when she ran out of food. Staff was warm and kind. I liked that they cut herbs from plants growing in the restaurant, peak freshness there! Looking forward to coming back for other breakfast items as well as lunch. Kudos to a place that has half marathon and marathon stickers on the door! :-)

Came by on opening day. We are dying for good restaurants up in this area. Was so excited to see this going in. The menu is small which is understandable for a new restaurant, but that's the only reason for the 4 stars, instead of 5. Would love to see some more variety. The atmosphere is ok, I'm sure its a work in progress. But more importantly, the food. We came for lunch and had burgers. Great burgers. I don't eat red meat, so I've had many, many turkey burgers all over town. This one was very good. Obviously hand made, fresh ground turkey, well seasoned. (I was asked how I wanted my turkey burger cooked. Haha.) The fries were fresh cut and cooked, very good. My husband had a regular cheeseburger. He said it was a great burger as well. Very friendly, will definitely be back. I really hope this area gets behind this restaurant and keeps it open. Love having a place we can walk to that isn't a chain.
Didn't really liked what we ordered. I'm not sure if we will be back, although, last time I had wrap. It was pretty darn good.

The meal was not bad, the atmosphere is mellow and pleasing.  The problem I have is with the customer service aspect, keeping the customer happy and returning. 
My wife buys an entertainment book every year from the local girl scouts. When we decide to go out to eat, we just cycle through the coupons to choose the next restaurant. It's great because we are always trying something new (and getting a discount).  It's a win for both us and the restaurant gaining a potentially new customer.  This time it's for the divine eatery.  It's very frustrating to choose a place because of a deal they've made with the coupon book people, go out, eat a meal, and then be told that they are no longer accepting coupons. Even though it's no where near it's expiration. Just to fill you in it's a buy one entree get one entree free (so about $9 in this case).  It's not about the money... Okay it's a little about the money, but it's more about the principal. You're going to tell a customer 'no' thus ensuring they're dining experience at your establishment is a one time thing rather than honor a voucher with your business' name on it??  Well done divine eatery... Good luck with your business because it will not get any more of mine or my family's money. The reason I didn't give one star is because the waiter was very nice, and apologetic, and the food was better than I expected it to be.

Fabulous French toast!  The portion sizes are more than enough to fill you up. Friendly and welcoming staff but most importantly, very clean! Viri  is the lovely lady who helped us. Her smile and attitude will brome back!

Solid four star restaurant! If you're looking for refined this is not your spot but...if you're looking for delicious food, you need to swing by Divine Eatery! Large portions, food clearly made from scratch, an eclectic feel, good service and a decent price...
Hidden gem! Friendly and fast service. We've been here about 4 times in last 6 months. For breakfast, their omelette are delicious. For lunch, you must try the chicken salad wrap. So yummy.

I live in Providence and was super excited to get a new addition to our "shops". We visited at lunchtime on a Saturday and while busy, they were not packed. Most tables already had food when we come in and there were several minutes between us and the next table that entered. Service was very polite but extremely slow.

I am assuming it is because the place is brand new, but the ambiance is very bland. Solid walls with only one small piece of art. The mish mash of tables doesn't bother me, but I seriously wondered if the chair I sat in was going to hold me (very wobbly).

Drinks are WAY overpriced, but the food prices for the most part are reasonable.

I had the pulled pork sandwich and potato salad. The sandwich was fantastic, fresh and flavorful. The potato salad was good, but I am not a fan of mustard based salads (my fault, I should have asked). Potatoes were fresh and tender, but not fall apart tender, so they stuck on your fork.

DH had the biscuits and gravy with scrambled eggs and seasoned potatoes. The food all needed a bit of salt, but otherwise was very tasty and hearty.

DD had the "fingers", panko breaded chicken fingers. I was a little put off that it did not come with fries, so we added those on. The fingers are real chicken and substantial pieces. It was tender and juicy. The fries appear to be hand cut and were really yummy once you added some salt.

All in all, we will be back. I think once a few of the new business kinks are worked out, this will be a regular stop for us!

No thank you. 

I've never felt compelled to write a review as a sit at the table. BUT, since they're taking so long to even notice that we haven't had water and drinks since they gave us our first glasses, then by all means- as good a time as any. Our meal is done. And still no darn drinks. 

From the time they put our meal on the table, it's been 35 minutes and no refill. It's not even that busy.  It's steady, but it's certainly not busy. 

My home chips. It's delicious if you like oil oozing into your mouth as you take each bite. I am not one to leave leftovers on my plate, but this time- yuck. 

Omelette. Over done. Wth. If you wear a chefs hat and a very very tall one at that to showcase your ranking-- at least cook properly. And it's a breakfast place for crying out loud. Please get off your high horse and put away your undeserving ranking system. 

Country fried steak. Overdone. Chewy and blah. All sooooo blah. I need to stop writing. Weve been finished with our meal. Still no check, no drinks. 

Oh. Well. 

Oh and the coffee? Burnt and bitter. Disgusting.

Visited on father's day, service was prompt, we had eggs Benedict, healthy breakfast and original. Hollandaise sauce was excellent,  healthy breakfast was packed with flavor.

Location is a little tough to find but worth it.

I live next door and eat here every chance I get...everything on this menu is made with pride as if the chef himself was going to eat it...any kind of French toast here is amazing...egg Benedicts are awesome...any sandwich is amazing...EVERYTHING here is delicious and the price wow you can't beat if

Not the best food. My Muslim client asked for no bacon and they put bacon below the burger patty and she accidentally had some. It was pretty bad. 

My country fried steak was meh. Not hot and kinda dry. Gravy was not especially good. Fruit was also not very fresh looking. 

I'd almost put two stars but I want to support local business.

If you live in providence this breakfast joint is centrally located. Been here multiple times and the prices are reasonable. Only a 3 as the service has been a hit and a miss the last two times we went.

This place is great! I usually order the throwback. It comes with pancakes, eggs, bacon and potatoes. It reminds me of Saturday morning breakfast as a child. The pancakes are fluffy and have a good vanilla flavor to them. They come with fresh strawberries and whipped cream. They are sweet on their own, the syrup isn't necessary with the whip cream. I really love them. The only thing I don't like is they have a strange after taste, it tastes like they make the pancakes on the same griddle or spot that they make the bacon/meat. It tastes unintentional and makes me wonder if there is a cross contamination going on. Not raw food wise but while on the griddle like the grease may come in contact with the batter? It's weird. I'm not vegetarian but if I was I'd be concerned. 

I LOVE the potatoes they are not your regular "hash brown" they are diced and fried. My favorite!! The eggs are average as well as the bacon. 

For all that food it's around $10. Can't beat it! 

This is a a nice neighborhood spot for a breakfast you aren't in the mood to make. I wish they were open longer for lunch/dinner though. They close at 2pm. :/

I don't know why this place isn't crowded because the food is very fresh and tasty.  I think because it is tucked inside a little strip mall.  I think handing out flyers would help the business so everyone knows it's there.  The bagel smoked salmon was so good.  Be sure to tell them to toast it!  Yummo!

What could be better then Divine Eatery for Breakfast and Lunch...how about Dinner! Love the new dinner menu and hours of operation.  Best place in the area to go for amazing food, incredible conversation, and just an overall all around great time.  The head chef is the best and takes the time to ensure that the food is out of this world.  The entire staff is extremely helpful which help to drive the overall customer experience. I've never been to another restaurant where you go there...get great food...and get treated like your part of the family! 

One warning however...go once...and you'll be hooked forever cause ya just can't get enough!

The staff is what is driving the rating to a three. When we walked in we were not greeted.  You seat yourself,  which is not a big deal.  However the runner was not personable and did not say a single thing to us and just handed us menus. He came back a couple of moments later to ask what we would like to drink. Our waitress waited on two other tables that came in after us before coming over to take our order. She never introduced herself and simply asked us if we were ready to order. We didn't find out her name until we received our check. She was slightly more friendly towards the end. The food was good and I would give it four stars. There wasn't anything out of this world about it, but it was comforting. I would eat there again; but maybe get it to go.  We had the sausage biscuits with gravy and the bacon sandwich.
The food was ok... the price was moderate... when we went, it didn't look open because nobody was in the establishment.  The waitress was super nice and attentive! We'd go back.
Had a very good experience nice staff great food. We liked the small Cafe hole in the wall look and feel. Feels like your own house.

Divine Eatery is a hidden gem! The chef makes excellent homemade biscuits and gravy that are to die for! The red velvet pancakes were such a perfect dessert for breakfast option! And how could I forget the deep fries Oreos!? Mmmm. The two ladies Ester and Fanny that helped us were so kind and polite. I will definitely dine here every chance I get!

Divine Eatery is a new spot that's basically within walking distance for a lot of people in Providence. For starters, the "decor" in here is super weird. I think they tried way too hard to be trendy and it comes off tacky. Every chair and table in the place is different, almost like someone went around to yard sales and got the cheapest kitchen furniture they could find. My chair was wobbly so I know it wasn't new stuff. Besides that, the walls are also completely bare...no pictures, art, signs, nothing! 

Their menu is also a little on the weird side. It's very limited and the way it's typed up is awkward. And the food doesn't save this place either. I went with the Divine Throwback which is basically just a pancake and two egg breakfast priced at $10! The pancakes were bland and tough, I could barely cut them with my fork.
