For some reason they add powdered sugar to them but barely any at that, so it adds no flavor. The rest was just basic stuff anyone can make at home, but make better. My meal also included burnt bacon and unseasoned home fries...Yum! My son got chocolate chip pancakes which were ok but only cause they had chocolate in them. Basically the pancakes don't even stand out against regular boxed pancake mix. 

I'm not sure how this place will stay in business other than being the only breakfast spot that is so close to all those homes. They don't offer anything unique and it's overpriced. $3 for sodas and iced tea...we're not in downtown LV here! The service was decent but that's not hard to accomplish with only two tables at 10am. There's plenty of other breakfast spots less than 10 minutes away...I'll pick one of those next time!

The food was delicous. Flavors were on point and everything tasted fresh. The meat lovers breakfast burrito was delicous and the biscuits and gravy were homemade! The best part was the service - it was amazing. I haven't been taken care of that we'll in a long time. Will definitely be going back!

Ordered veggie omelette. It said I had to choose a side so I ordered trail mix. They threw loose trail mix in the same package with the omelette. Which ruined the trail mix and the omelette. Toast was literally like eating card board. Gotta say not impressed.

Upon arrival I was promptly greeted and offered a table - seating is first come first served.  I got my coffee quick and it was hot and tasty.   From others posts I ordered the Nutty French Toast.   It was wonderful.   I had them add a side of cream cheese frosting and it all quickly disappeared.   I will be back.

I had the Steak Melt with coleslaw and it was delicious, greasy but that comes with eating a melt. Casual cafe style, received our food in a reasonable amount of time, a little pricey but the food is very good.

Discovered this place by Groupon. 2nd visit, had a BBQ Burger and wife had the Turkey Melt sandwich. Daughter had grilled cheese. DE prepares all their food to order and ingredients are fresh. The burger was delicious, would definitely get again. My wife loved her turkey melt sandwich just as delicious. Grill cheese looks like one and that your mother would make. And their fries just melt in your mouth they remind me of boardwalk fries. I want to have taken a picture of the food but it was so delicious I couldn't stop to take a pic.

Found Divine Eatery on Yelp. Good food, especially liked the fried potatoes. The service was excellent from the owner on down, attentive but not intrusive. Large fun menu with lots of choices. Somewhat hard to find in a little strip mall, Yelp  directions not the greatest, don't make a u-turn, just a left turn and go about 50 yards and make a left into the mall.

Nice little mom and pop place in northwest Las Vegas.  Food is good much better than going to any place like Denny's or IHOP and the price is about the same. I would definitely recommend checking it out

As much as I believe in sowing into my local community, it's difficult to support a business with a menu that is clearly over priced. The coffee was delicious, but at $4 a cup, I decided to have breakfast elsewhere. I hope this restaurant can make it in Providence.

Not bad. But please use salt and pepper with the breakfast potatoes and especially the country gravy. Always taste what your making. 
We will try this another time and see if it changes. It's always nice to support our little local community places.

California omelet and pumpkin stacks ! And the coffee. Don't bother with the over done potatoes they are always over done and dried out because they sit there for hours. Try the red velvet stack you won't believe how homemade and unpackaged they taste! french toast is my husbands favorite I don't know what kind of bread but it works well with the batter. It might have line but it's worth the wait!

In the NW area this is a hidden gem. I used to live in this area so I was happy to go back. They have a very homey environment with an open kitchen concept.

You seat yourself and they have about 12 tables. It's a small diner. Not for massive parties. Defiantly more of a local trap so people on the other side of town don't know about it. That's the power of yelp!

If you are in this area or don't mind a drive to the NW I would highly recommend this place. I've eaten here many times. I always used to eat the corn flake French toast alllllll the time. Recently I tried a normal all American breakfast. I got 3 eggs over hard with bananas and a side of turkey sausage. My friend had the chilaquiles they were reallllly good with home made chips.

Service is always friendly, i feel it may be family owned I don't know though. Employees are always happy and cooks get the job done! Great job :)

Small traditional diner with healthy choices and quite good coffee for the folks who like simple plain coffees and they have fresh jalpenos not those crappy pickled ones.  Love finding these little locally owned places.

Wanted to come and check this place out after i read so many great reviews, so it finally happened. We went Sunday morning for breakfast annndddd we were kind of let down. First off their freshly brewed coffee was $4! Leone cafe among other places are freshly brewed for 2.50-3.00. Then the
Food that came was nothing worth $14 bucks a plate. I understand that they buy and make everything fresh, but $40 for coffee and eggs was a little over the top, especially since it was nothing out of this world. Food was just okay. Wish it would have been better, since I love going to mom and pop shops.

Mediocre... we went in a few weeks ago wanting to try a new place close to home and found a  Groupon for here. The service was ok I have no complaints but the food is under seasoned. We came in a party of 6 and not one person was excited about their dish. We left with full tummys. Not sure if I'd return though.

5 stars all the way. A small intimate setting with great food and great service.  It is a must do if you are in the providence area.  Chef Esther will make you what you want or select from their many menu options.   Definitely will keep you coming back for more.  They are not responsible for your midnight cravings.  : )

I had placed this at the bottom of my bookmarked list because of the mixed reviews and now I understand why I should have gone with my gut.

We ordered the sausage biscuits, chili omelet and chilaquiles (without pork). I didn't take any pictures because quite frankly there wasn't anything exceptional about the appearance. 

My son's sausage biscuits had jelly with the egg, cheese and sausage (jelly was inside the sandwich). It was one of those times that I was ok with him not finishing his food. 

My chilaquiles was not very enjoyable...tortillas were soggy, not much cheese or sour cream and green chili tasted like it was store bought.

My husbands chili omelet was ok - nothing to celebrate. The toast that came with it was slightly burnt and "home fries" tasted stale with no seasoning. 

The orange juice ordered was $3.95 - even though it was store bought where I saw the juice container sitting in ice that it came from. 

While our server was great and the resturant was very clean with nice art you could purchase - I don't see us being repeaters.
Me and the wife's favorite little neighborhood joint. We had lunch last week and it's just as good as the breakfasts we've been enjoying. Love this place, highly recommend!

Average food for a high price. Ordered Chilaquiles and Funky Monkey French toast. The French toast was very greasy and disappointing did not have a flavor of peanut butter at all as it suggested in the menu, it also did not have candy bananas as it suggested in the menu. Chilaquiles were not very flavorful. At 1:20 PM two customers arrived and were turned away, because they were closing early although there was no sign indicating that. The server could not answer questions about items on the menu. Interesting set up and decent location but will definitely not return.

Fresh, made to order food - you can really taste the quality. The fries and home potatoes are cut right there when you order them. The chef is the owner and clearly pours her heart into it. And the place is CLEAN. Can't beat it.

I ordered an omelette and a parfait to go. The parfait was OK, but the omelette was very nasty and they got my order wrong. It was a very simple order I don't see how they could've got it wrong. They loaded the omelette up with way too much cheese and they didn't put the Turkey sausage in it. I was just trying it out because it's literally three minutes away from my house and there's not a lot of stuff over here. I don't suggest this place to anybody, I'd rather take the extra 5 minute drive and go over to baby cakes for breakfast.

Smart and final products on a plate.

After seeing this place had good reviews I decided to give it a try only to find that this little place serves mediocre food and charges $4 for a cup of store bought coffee.

It's an unusual set up inside with no hostess stand or check in area, a seat yourself atmosphere with a view of the "kitchen" and open floor plan for servers to grab your drinks or coffee and garage sale find decor splashed in random places throughout the restaurant. 

I ordered the "Divine original" and a short stack of the nutty french toast. My partner ordered the Denver omelet. I was able to see the chef from my table and everything we ordered was pre-made, generic, boxed items. He pulled my french toast out of the fridge and threw it in the deep fryer (why?) to cook, used box eggs, pre-made potatoes and the coffee was from Winco, not some special roast their website claims it to be. 

We received our food and were both unimpressed with the outcome. It all tasted bland and like something we could have made at home for less money and a better price. Lesson learned.

We won't be returning but on a positive note the service was great.

Another review of places to eat near the new house, this one less than a mile away I think.  

It has an average of 4 stars but we were a bit cautious because of the "suburban star rating" theory but had no reason to worry, it's definitely an eatery that has a lot going for it.  Its location is good, in a small strip mall with ample parking. The inside feels like the perfect size for a neighborhood eatery and is clean and cheery, as well.  The staff is also friendly and attentive.  The best reason of course is the food, some well prepared versions of the standard diner breakfast/lunch meals with a few creative variations thrown in.

I had the Country fried steak which was really good.  They used a good quality of cubed steak that was thicker than the normal pieces I get at other places.  The steak was pretty tender as well with a nice crunchy breading.  The sausage gravy was your standard white gravy with bits of sausage in it.  The potatoes were done nicely and the two eggs that came with the dish (ordered sunnyside up) were done perfectly.  I'm a sucker for runny yolk for sure.

Mark H had the Country Benedict - sausage patty, poached egg, country gravy on English muffin.  It's also served with a huge portion of breakfast potatoes, huge enough for people that want to carbo-load for a marathon or just trying to add to their girth.  He said the dish was really tasty.

As a bonus, we split a half order of the Nutty french toast.  It's Texas toast, battered and dipped in chopped pecans with some caramel sauce covering to boot.  This was pretty good, hit the sweet tooth nicely.

Quite a few menu options here from Benedicts, Griddle or Skillet meals, Omelets, and even a few mexican dishes like Burritos and Chilaquiles.  When I'm up there during New Year's, I'm pretty sure we'll eat here again.

If I could rate it 0 I would. Get seated and waited over 10 min for menus...FOR MENUS. Set the tone for the rest of the experience. Food took forever and there were no apologies only some quip that went something like, "I know you've been waiting a while" after which we continued to wait longer. I asked for water that came 15 min later. I've had terrible service that was redeemed by amazing food; however, this was not the case. Favorite part of the meal was finding egg shells in my wife's burger. Sad part is the waitress is the owner and seemed to be without a care. Will not be going back

The food here is great. Lots of choices for breakfast and lunch that are unexpected but delicious. The breakfast potatoes are amazing, well seasoned not bland at all. This may be my new breakfast place. 

Oh and the people that work their are genuine happy and kind and act as if they really love their job. 

Mismatched tables/chairs and tree art abound. But go well with the quirky open kitchen friendly atmosphere of this place. 

Unfortunate is the look of the strip mall it is in with it's characteristic suburban unoriginal style and strangely cramped parking lot typical of the poor design of this part of Vegas.  

However the staff and food transport you to another world which is truly divine. I'm glad it is here and not another corporate waste of space.
Really great food! Well seasoned and cooked to perfection. Check the menu-they serve some unusual combinations. The price is excellent, great service. I recommend the country fried steak.

A charming nook with friendly service which made me want to make this relationship work. The street taco was the size of Barbies lunch.The meat was dry, no taste, and for $2? I got over it as I was looking forward to my chicken salad wrap. Waiting to taste the sweet cranberries, red onions, pecans in every bite, but where are they? "Excuse me sir, but more than half of the ingredients are missing in my wrap!" Instead of making me a new one, the server gives me a side of cranberries and walnuts. I ate my wrap sprinkling cranberries and walnuts into each bite like some salt and pepper shakers. My garlic fries were not only cold but... where is the garlic?? Hello... are your cooks on the NyQuil bandwagon? I was afraid he would come back with garlic cloves for me to peel, chop and sprinkle onto my fries myself. Oddly, he didn't come back with new GARLIC fries, but offered a side of mayonnaise with his finger half way in it. Sigh... sorry for the low blow, but my eatery experience wasn't in the least bit Divine.

A delicious local place that's tucked away in a local neighborhood. Love this place because the portions are large, the service is amazing and they offer you coffee to go!! This will now be our "go to" breakfast place.

Very disappointed.  Went here for Sunday brunch.  Small dining room in a strip mall.  The staff was very young, there were only two servers and they were both about 16 or 17.  There was also another bus boy who was like 14 and took our drink order.  After about 10 min he came back to the table and told us they had to brew another pot of coffee.  Ok? Can we have the other drinks we ordered?  Anyway, we finally got the coffee and he took our order. 20 min in at this point. 
They have a nice menu, good selection!
I ordered the Devine pancakes, other people in my party ordered the Eggs Benedict, the Bagel and Lox plate, and French toast, and a parfait.
The service was just terrible.  Never refilled the coffee, sodas or iced tea.  The food took forever!  The pancakes were very good.  The Eggs Benedict was ok,  the sauce had no flavor, potatoes were cold. The French toast was good.  The person who ordered the bagel and lox got a bagel with cream cheese.  He sent it back saying he ordered the lox plate.  They brought it back with lox on it but no tomatoes and onions, as the menu stated.  Also we asked for the parfait we ordered.   
At this point we just ate what we had and tried to enjoy our brunch.  
They brought the check and the parfait about 10 min after we finished our meal.  It was nasty and we just laughed at that point.  We would have complained to a manager, but there was no one in the building who looked old enough to vote.   Won't be back!

This place was yummy! Have to get the frosted flakes french toast--SOO GOOD!! Their biscuit and gravy is pretty good too!! Def worth ordering again thats for sure! I also got the chorizo burrito with eggs and potatoes..i didn't like it at all. It was sooo dry and had no flavor whatsoever. Dont order it.

Been here 3 times and each times for breakfast an have had nothing but good experiences.  I tend to gravitate to the Biscuit an Gravy plate served with the home fries and scrambled eggs.  My older brother had the create your own omelet with a stack of pancakes and only finished half the food, the servings are done right.  With menu items like frosted flake French toast what more do you need to now.

Just ok bland food, prices are way too high for the quality of food they serve here. This place will find its self belly up soon. I had the eggs Benedict, skinny skillet and frosted flake French toast. Not worth the money.

Food here is fresh and served hot. No frozen items here. Potatoes are yummy! Our waitress was very friendly and made sure we were happy with our meal. This place is close to home and feels like grandmas house with the old maple furniture. We will definitely be back to try other dishes.
My husband and I go here almost every Sunday for breakfast. The food is delicious and everyone is super friendly. I've never had a disappointing meal here.

So happy my husband found this gem in our neighborhood! The customer service is solid and the food is tasty. It's not what I'd call health food, but it's fresh and made to order. It's difficult to find a diner/casual dining atmosphere that delivers creative food. Divine Eatery does just that and they deliver with a smile. It's the first place in Vegas where I felt like a regular since I was consistently greeted with a smile and the staff remembered how my husband and I like our coffee!

Great food!  So fresh and made to order.  Service is kind of slow and the food doesn't always all come out at the same time.  They offer military and Traditions (Providence homeowners) discounts!  :-)
The burgers are delicious. Great toppings but not so much that you can't taste the meat. Garlic fries are really garlicky and delicious.
Pretty good burger and fries are okay. Doesn't look as beautiful as their main picture though... I'd still go back.

Great homemade food cooked and served by nice folks. We had country fried steak that was, get this.... actually made there, not taken out of a package and throw in the frier. The pork and cabbage benedict was very good as well. Great coffee!

I just wanted to say that this place has some amazing, fresh food. I went with my sister after I went to the hospital the night before. I wanted some fresh, delicious food and I definitely got it here! I built my own omelet with mushrooms, onions, tomatoes, spinach, and american cheese. The cheese was like Velveeta, which was AMAZING, and the vegetables were cooked to perfection. I normally don't like omelets because the eggs are not fluffy enough but this one was perfect. So fluffy, perfect texture and consistency, and perfectly cooked vegetables. What else could I ask for? Well, awesome service! They were very attentive and descriptive. Overall, the experience was great! I will definitely be coming back when I'm in the NW part of town.

The food was ok nothing special. I ordered a cup of their coffee and was shocked when I got the bill and it was $3.95. Starbucks doesn't even charge that much for a cup of regular black coffee. Anyways it's a small place with friendly service it was just more expensive then I thought it should be.

Great name for this cafe. The food is so fresh and delicious. I had the pulled pork sandwich. The fresh onion straws were a super add to the sandwich.  Next time I'll ask for it on a plate instead of the basket as you need to eat it with a knife and fork.

The turkey burger is divine with tasty herb seasoning.....no ketchup was needed! Also loved the deep fried pickles:)  It's nice to have a local restaurant in the neighborhood that isn't a national chain.  Divine Eatery was recommended by a friend and we're glad we checked it out.  Love the homemade fries too!

This place was a really great surprise. Friendly staff served us really fast with good coffee. We had the chilaquiles, sausage sandwich and the egg and cheese scramble. Each dish was really well done and tasted delicious. If you're looking for the place with Apple maps, be aware that it puts the destination on the wrong side of the road. You'll find it in the strip mall on the other side of the road. 

Highly recommend this place!

Its in the details...while waiting to drop off packages to mail..decided to give Divine Eatery a try...sad to say my 1st time with the original owners...was a crash and burn to say the least...WHAT A DIFFERENCE. I dont need a fancy breakfast to get my day going, just solid food...prepare how I  request... and my day will start off great
.which it is....wasnt into the cinnamon biscuit..they offered toast as a replacement....over easy eggs
Were just that..perfectly done..well done potatoes..you bet. Watching the chef and staff head down..pushing out food...was a pleasure. You all just gained a regular..great job!

And they topped my coffee off to go when i left as well!

Love this place. Found it by trolling for a new breakfast spot on Yelp. It's a little funky with the mismatched furniture and plates but that is a big part of it's charm. The food is outstanding. We have sampled most of the offerings from the menu and have yet to be disappointed. My only gripe, if you want to call it that, is that there is so much food on the plate. The very friendly staff is willing to do anything to ensure an excellent experiance is had. They just started serving dinner on Friday, Saturday and Sunday. Haven't tried it yet but if the dinner is anything like the breakfast and lunch, I know we won't be disappointed.

I love this place! Semi Finalist in Food Wars!If you are looking for a great place to eat with excellent and genuine service, you have to grab and seat and indulge. Fresh ingredients and absolutely DELICIOUS! I love how the cook stopped by my table to check how everything was tasting. Even the owner. My waitress was top notch too! Mover Mimi's Cafe, Divine Eatery is my fav.

Inconsistency is just plain annoying!!! I went to divine Eatery last week for the first time  and really loved the place!! I had the chicken fried steak and it was delicious, crispy but still juicy. The gravy was authentic southern style, not lumpy again delicious.. So when I was craving it this morning I was thrilled to have the same delicious experience all over again.. Well inconsistency showed up and ruined my breakfast.. Before I even cut into it I knew it was different, it wasn't golden brown or crispy. I cut into it and was greeted with a very undercooked bite, chewy and just gross!! The potatoes were overcooked and the fluffy, warm biscuit I had last week was more like a brick today. Does it get better? Nope,  the gravy was lumpy, and more similar to concrete than gravy... The waitress was very accommodating and took it off the bill.  Funny thing is my wife didn't really enjoy what she had last week but loved the pumpkin pancakes she got today... I really want to love this place but if the inconsistency continues I won't hesitate to go to Bagel Cafe instead.....

This place is about 5 minutes from my house. I've lived in this house for almost 3 years and my husband and I JUST coincidently stumbled upon it. The sad part is, we've been looking for a little place like this for years. Guess we need to start opening our eyes. The food is great, so is the service. Will be coming in often for a long time!!
Great little hole in the wall cafe.  Food is good but coffee is GREAT!  This is a quiet neighborhood cafe that is low key and perfect for Sunday mornings!
Great mom and pop bfast/lunch cafe. Awesome food. Great service. God's blessings Esquivil, Viri, Sam, and Miguel!
Nice and cozy, great place to each breakfast or lunch in a small group. There is not much room but the food makes up for that. Everything is from scratch and couldn't taste better

Oh how I wanted to like it here. The workers are really friendly. So there is that. 

As we walked through the door it was a bit underwhelming, but not too bad. It has potential. We were seated right away and placed our order soon after. 

We watched the chef in the kitchen as he worked. What was weird was that the drink station was out in the dining room. And the workers did their side work right there at a table also in the dining room. That was not a very comfortable situation. 

Our food arrived, and we dug in. I love Eggs Benedict. It's one of my all time favorites. What was good here was that the eggs were done perfectly. The muffins needed to be toasted, and the hollandaise was so lacking in flavor. It desperately needed Worcestershire and lemon juice. We also had the South of the Border Omelette with chorizo and jalapeño. It was overcooked. The potatoes needed more seasoning as well. 

The workers were very nice, but it was obvious that they needed training. Our dishes remained at our table even after we paid. This place has so much potential, but it was really lacking.

Okay, so the country fried steak and gravy were both highly mediocre.  L and I are southerners, so we can be gravy snobs.  The biscuits were almost certainly Pillsbury, but they were baked perfectly, so that's not necessarily a bad thing.  The home fries were good and they get top marks for fast and very friendly service.  We will be back to try other menu items.

Service was good. The Home fries were great and the best part of our visit.
I had the Un-Red velvet pancakes-short stack. It was 2 large pancakes, but something was missing besides the red food coloring. They just didn't taste right (almost like the batter was old). The pancake on the bottom was very dry as the icing was only enough for the top. I have eaten red velvet pancakes at Babystacks and they don't even need icing/syrup.
The Throwback plate eggs were ordered Over Medium but were more like Over Easy-Sausage links were not cooked long enough and a little spicy-got the french toast with this and it was burnt on 1 side. But the home fries were excellent-hot-nicely browned-and lightly seasoned. Maybe it was a off day for the kitchen, but they were not busy when we got there.
I loved it!! Decent prices for great food. My skillet breakfast was delicious. It's 5 minutes from my place, not extremely busy and good service.

So Delish!! We had the country fried steak, home fries, eggs, bacon, nutty French toast, biscuit, coffee, BBQ burger and fries. Everything was awesome. Everything. Highly recommend this place ! Only critique would be that the fries were too salty and we like salt... Maybe ask for low salt on the fries. Service was great.
The service was excellent!!! The food was delicious. Biscuits and gravy was bomb, lol... Not so bad prices. I actually ate at the table I donated here. Wtf!!!
The food is pretty good. At times, some of the food is cold or not completely cooked. However, the staff will correctly fix this mistake without a problem. Nice hidden gem.

This is a great place to have a good cup of Joe in the morning. A lot of places around offer pretty much the same, omelets, sandwiches, etc, pancakes, breakfast in a hurry and with poor service....but finding a place with good coffee, good food and attentive service all in one, is not always easy.....this place has it. We go very often and the place is nice and small but we always feel welcome. Their pancakes are delicious. Is not a fast food place so don't expect the waiters to be all over you, they give you space and since the place is always packed (try a Sunday at 9am) be prepared to have a nice, no hurries breakfast.
I had the pulled pork sandwich & the husband had wings & pattie melt.  Delicious!   I can't wait to come back to try the pancakes!

This is a casual, Saturday morning place where you feel comfortable, seat yourself and get great service.  The food is pretty good.  This morning we had chicken fried steak, south of the border omelette and chilequiles.  The chilequiles by far were the best meal..  The steak was a little bland and tasted like flour.  The south of the border omelette was ok.  $50 for three of us.
The food was really good, but it took forever to get out to us. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I will definitely go back to try out the breakfast options.

Definitely not my favorite place to eat breakfast. Came in today and saw 4 tables that weren't cleaned off and they remained that way the whole time we were there (see attached photo). Obviously the waitress was overwhelmed. I had to walk across and ask her to refill my coffee. My wife's meal had Eggs Benedict had almost no hollandaise sauce on it. Kids pancakes were so dry and over cooked they were hard to cut with a fork. I ordered biscuits and gravy and the they were so hard on bottom I had to use a knife. I have heard good things about this place, but today was not their day.
This cafe is a quaint little place with good customer service. The waiters are very nice and the facility is clean. The pancakes are DELICIOUS!!!!!! I will be eating here frequently.

We were pleasantly surprised by this hidden gem.   We went for breakfast and the food actually tastes like its home cooked - the atmosphere was diner like, which I prefer, cozy. We will be returning soon - and we totally recommend.
Quaint little place. Food is always on point. The Fonte Coffe is some of the best coffe I ever had. Love it!

This little cute place is the only sit down restaurant in our the Providence community that I am aware of.  Came on a Groupon and was surprised in a good way by the food.  Had the breakfast sandwich which was 2 hard eggs, bacon and American cheese; took me back to my childhood.  My hubby ordered the "throwback" with an upcharge for the pumpkin pancakes which were AMAZING!!  Miguel, my server, was super attentive, nice and efficient.  Prices are very reasonable; lots of things available for $10.  Would definitely come back.

A little difficult to get in to, but absolutely worth it. Fantastic service, delicious food. I had the french toast with caramel and pecans, my mom had the pumpkin pancakes and my aunt the chicken fried steak. Everything was delicious, the coffee was worth the price, and they weren't stingy with the refills either. Definitely will keep going back.

First time coming here, it's been on our list to try as we live just down the street. What a let down. Came around 11 on a Monday and there was only one server for the whole place. It's not that big to begin with, but she was in charge of seating, serving, and bussing with no help. Our drinks were empty for most of our meal, no refills, had to ask for silverware, never got any extra napkins... can't really hold her at fault. She was very kind but I could hear her apologizing to every single table because there was no way she was able to run that whole place by herself. The food was a let down too. I got the eggs Benedict which had a side of home fries. There was hardly any hollandaise and the potatoes were so bland. My husband got the burger which was alright but the fries were limp and soggy. I don't know what management is doing, but they need to get some staff in there. The quality of the food was nowhere near what they were charging. Disappointed for sure.

Service was 4 stars... Prices are too high for local spot.  Might as well eat breakfast on the strip.  $4.00 for tropicana orange juice (prices should be for fresh squeezed). Coffee that is supposedly special import from Seattle, not as good as Seattles best ($4.00). 4 entrees $56 plus tip was $66 for family of 4.  Will not be rushing back even if service was good.  Overall-  average food, great service but pricy for local spot.
There food wasn't to bad but the service was horrible they took forever to take our order then it took forever to get our food and check... They really need more servers

I love the feel of this cafe! I have been wanting to try this cafe for a while since I live right down the street. As soon as I enter I get a greeting and the hometown feel I was looking for! The food is fresh and well priced! I can eat eggs, sausage, potatoes and toast for 7 dollars! Other places that dish would be 12 dollars! Great place !

Went for brunch this morning, wanted to try this place out since it is right down the street.  The interior is somewhat kitchy, with mismatched table & chairs, a little strange. We ordered the meat lovers burrito and the chicken fried steak, both were very good, but a bit pricey.  The highlight was the waitress, she was pleasant and very attentive.  Another bonus; a 10% military discount.  Overall, good food, great service.
Awesome biscuits and gravy. Gotta try the snores pancakes. The eggs Benedict were awesome as well.

Stopped in for a late breakfast, the place is small and homey. This place is filled with familiar dining tables and chairs you would find in a house. They serve a special Seattle coffee brew or Folgers. The biscuits and gravy were great, with the "nutty French toast" on the side. Everything taste fresh and is prepared well.

What a fantastic combination of diner-style decor and expertly prepared food!  I have been there with my family several times now, and am always impressed with the overall quality of the meals. All ingredients are very fresh and the greens are always bright. My daughter always gets the eggs Benedict. The flavor of the Hollandaise and the spices of the hash browns are fantastic. The atmosphere is very open and extremely clean. I cannot wait until they start serving dinners too!

Went there on the recommendation of a friend. The atmosphere is somewhat eclectic , but we were there to eat the food. Two of us had the California omelette and we both found the omelette to be dry. The tuna sandwich was bland, no mayo, and not to our friends liking. The green tea was awesome. 

Service was friendly, but the tables weren't the cleanest, and the color scheme atrocious. Should've stuck with the burger, bacon, and onions. That looked great, and was how we came to hear of this place in the first place. If we do go back, we will have to try that, but the odds are slim for a repeat.
I tried this restaurant via Uber Eats.   The food was tasty but not as hot as I would have preferred.  I will go to the restaurant itself to give it another try.

Thanks to Groupon, I ate here for breakfast this weekend, had eggs, potatoes and pancakes, along with absolutely delicious coffee!  It was a comfortable environment with very friendly servers.  I loved the mismatched coffee cups and was made to feel very comfortable staying to visit with my friend even after we had finished eating.  I was a little hesitant when I first arrived as the outside just looked like a storefront with a diner shoved in it, but this is truly a diamond in the rough!  I look forward to going back!

Food is pretty decent BUT waiting for 45min to get it was less than thrilling. Coffee is fantastic. They need to streamline their service a little better so I'll come back in 6 months to see if they've made some changes.

This place is my go to breakfast spot. My best friend and I try to go at least once a week for the oatmeal, breakfast sandwich, french toast and potatoes. 
Service is always wonderful and everyone is so friendly. My best friend happens to be vegan and they told her they could whip up vegan items at request. 
We always leave super happy.
This place is amazing the staff is so friendly and welcoming. The nutty French toast is absolutely fabulous.

I came for lunch with David S. He's been here previously and is my first time. 

We ordered the nutty french toast  short stack order ( 4 triangles) to share. They did not skimp on the pecans coating this and the caramel sauce was just right. I love pecan pie and french toast so this is a awesome combination of those.

I got eggs benedict as a main. I got the vegetarian one somehow even though I ordered the regular, but I totally didn't mind as it was very tasty with the tomato and spinach in lieu of ham. The one thing I highly respect is that I overheard that she was making fresh hollandaise as the last batch was splitting as it sat and she was not going to serve that. I admire high standards and the payoff is a beautiful creamy sauce and a pleased customer. That is one of the better bennys in town because of the perfect Hollandaise. The home fried potatoes were nicely seasoned as well.

David got the chorizo burrito. I took a bite and thought the flavors of it was great and it was a pretty sizable portion.

Our beverages was kept on by our server and the chef/owner came out to chat and was pretty personable. I like that this is a open kitchen and you can see them make your food.

 It's tucked into a sleepy shopping center in a subdivision called Providence, but definitely go off the path to this. Hopefully more of my area finds out about this place as I want it to stick around. Great first visit and I will be visiting very soon with the boyfriend.

Heard about this little place tucked into the N.W. Providence neighborhood from other Yelpers and decided to try it out. Tried the Biscuits and Gravy combo plate. Good biscuits with sausage gravy, delicious home fried potatoes but my scrambled eggs looked a little wimpy. Fortunately, since I don't eat eggs, I gave them to a friend who came with me. The decor is just an assortment of mismatched chairs and tables but this Saturday morning found a steady stream of local residents enjoying the breakfast items Divine Eatery had to offer. The pancakes (with strawberries and whipped cream) and bacon another friend ordered looked filling and delicious and they had no trouble finishing the entire serving. Nice breakfast cafe' in an unexpected location and will definitely be returning.

The food was good but be careful on the coffee. When ordering, we asked for coffee which was good but they do a bait and switch. The ticket said $4 for coffee but the small table tent tells you they have a 2 or 4 cup depending on if it is the special grind. We were not asked upon ordering. We got the $4 cup, wonder what refill we got to? This was a 2 for 1 visit, 1st and Last

This is such a bizarre location and out of the way of everything in Centennial. But, that could be a great thing for this place. 

We came here a coupe of weeks ago, and of course - we found it through Yelp. 

This is definitely your "ma and pop" kinda place. Very casual, very homey feeling and just good home cooked tasting meals. 

We had to share - 

Short stack of Chocolately Red Velvet Pancakes - goodness. I'm not big on sweets, but these were freaking delicious. They were so fluffy, full of flavor and the homemade whipped icing was the bestest. 

Biscuits and Gravy - very good. I usually don't get this because gravy is so filling, I barely eat anything. And sure enough, I ate about 1/4. The gravy is very good though. It's a very strong sausage flavor, which is why I loved it. The biscuits were very light and fluffy. Delicious. 

Eggs Benedict - very good. In comparison to most benedicts that are good. It wasn't anything out of the ordinary, but it was still delicious. 

Overall - the food is very good. Not over or under cooked, excellent service and it's just the perfect place to go to if you're not in the mood to cook a "country style" breakfast. 

Ready to go back and try things on their lunch menu!
Place was closed at 5:30 pm on a Wednesday. In fact it looks as if they can arbitrarily close whenever they want as there are no end of day hours posted. Very unprofessional to me.

I thought the waitstaff was friendly and I loved the atmosphere. I wanted so badly to like this place. We both ordered breakfast sandwiches which were ok but nothing special and overly greasy. The potatoes were amazing though. One of our sandwiches also had a string from a kitchen towel embedded in it. The waitstaff only offered a slight discount and didn't comp the entire price of the sandwich which also turned me off from going back.

When you search "burger" near my house, this is what pops up! 

A small cafe which was very quiet when I arrived on this Wednesday afternoon.  Definitely a local restaurant...I doubt anyone is traveling across town to eat here.

I came here with all intentions of ordering the "Patty Melt," but a BBQ sauce craving hit and trumped my original choice :)

8oz Divine BBQ Burger ($10): Cheddar Cheese, BBQ sauce, Crispy Bacon, Onion Strings & Fries. This was a very lean burger, cooked perfectly, just no juices on the squeeze.  It was not very messy at all actually...they could be a little more liberal with the BBQ sauce as well IMO.

Thankfully the patty itself was flavorful, and I enjoyed the flavor in the toppings very much, esp the bacon...which was pretty much perfect in my book!  Recommended :)

I'll be back to try the Patty Melt!

Bummer. Was looking for a great place to bring my hiking club in a couple of weeks on our way back from Mt Charleston. Stopped in with my husband at noon on Sunday. Had to wait for a short while as the place was packed. Our server got us seated, brought our drinks, took our order and that was the last we saw of her. (Not really ... she was standing at a nearby table chatting for the entire time we were there.) Another server brought our order (mine with the wrong side dish which that server did offer to change.) No one ever came back to our table to check on us. We finally flagged down a third server to ask for our check. He at least offered to refill our drinks. My burger was hot and juicy, the French fries just so so. My husband said the sausage gravy was the best he has eaten in Las Vegas. Too bad poor service always leaves a bad taste.

My wife and I went here to support the local business in the Providence area. The restaurant has only been open a week. The walls are still plain (no pictures, art, or signage, yet). Very quiet, with only three employees (Chef Esther (owner), Waitress Mary (friend of owner), and dishwasher son. Another customer couple was leaving as we sat down, while a third couple came in as we were leaving. So, steady business, but not overwhelming. This adds to the personal service received by not just Mary but Chef Esther as well. Everyone was so very friendly and polite!
The menu is just a two page flyer, but has all the offerings you'd expect from a 9 am - 5 pm cafe, at very reasonable prices.
The drinks ranged from fountain sodas, to flavored teas (hot and cold) and coffee. The coffee was extremely hot but a little weak for my taste, and the sweeteners available were only sugar, turbinado (cane sugar), and Stevia in the Raw. I think this goes with the natural, no preservatives thought of the restaurant. Still, I prefer Splenda.

Finally, the food. I had the Divine Biscuits and Gravy, which besides two biscuits with pork or turkey gravy, came with cubed potatoes ("home fries") and two eggs any style. The biscuits were the yellow, layered flaky kind, which is fancy. I prefer buttermilk biscuits, but these tasted good. The gravy was a bit bland, no meaty flavor. I suspect that because the restaurant is new, they make small portions, and the gravy doesn't have time to soak up the flavor of the meat? Perhaps even making a plain gravy then adding the type of meat to it upon ordering. The food came VERY hot, especially the potatoes that, once cooled, were very tasty. The over easy eggs I received were good, too.

My wife ordered "The Healthy Way" which was VERY flavorful, especially the "tomato composee" which was cubed tomatoes with basil. She gave me her wheat toast which was so light and crispy. VERY tasty! 

All in all, it was a very good experience. We will be going back again, bringing our teenage children. I believe with the foundation already in place, most notably the great service, this place is going to build up to be something amazing, and I'm glad that I will be there to experience it.


Walt D in LV

Food is great! I had the pulled pork sandwhich with onion strings inside, and it was delicious. I love the fact that they offer rasberry iced tea because not many places do. The service was good too. He came to my table and checked on things and made sure i left with a smile . Will definiteley be back!

Nice place close to home to have breakfast or lunch if you don't feel like cooking.  Tried the special, a Hawaiian burger with a turkey patty, was very delicious!  Other good was good too.  Kids chicken fingers and biscuits and gravy.

We ordered carry out from here today for our first time. 
The girl that took my order was very nice and helpful. She wasn't annoyed by all my questions and gave me recommendations, which I really appreciated.  Food was ready when we got there, about 15 min later, just like she told me.
Country Fried Steak- I did not love the meat. I think it's because it was a different consistency then I am accustomed to eating. I liked the breading, it reminded me of breaded Cuban steaks my aunt used to make. I asked for the eggs over hard and they were perfect. The potatoes were fresh and cut in up like home fries, but I prefer hash browns. I ordered it with a biscuit and had it smothered in gravy. BEST recommendation, it was amazing. The best part of my meal :)

Denver omelet- my husband said it was fresh, but wished we would have added cheese because it was dry. We ordered it with a biscuit, but they forgot to give it to us. No big deal, we should have checked the order when we picked it up. 

French toast- very good flavor and grilled perfectly. 

Side of bacon- asked for it crispy and it was perfect.

We will be coming back :)

My overall experience at Divine Eatery would better be described as deserving 3.5 stars, but what the hey, right? Located up in North NORTH town up in the quiet community of Providence, Divine Eatery is situated right in front of an apartment complex and a smattering of mostly local businesses. 

VEGGIE BURRITO ($10.95): Kind of pricey for a breakfast burrito, especially because there's no side! I wish there was more potatoes and that they were crispier. If there's such a thing as scrambled eggs being too moist, yup, that happened. The burrito was just okay. I would order something different next time - maybe pancakes! 3/5

STEAK MELT SANDWICH ($10.95): My husband opted for lunch instead. He LOVED his sandwich and raved that the meat was "the good stuff", i.e., not fatty. He also upgraded the fries to garlic fries for an extra $1. The fries were great! Super fresh! 4.5/5

SERVICE: The server was pleasant and the chef/owner was warm and friendly. Even though we came in 30 minutes before closing, the server didn't rush us at all and told us to take our time. Our server also sent us off with a to-go cup of a fountain drink ($2). Thanks! Cuz we thirsty! The chef chatted with us and told us how she used to work in the casinos and opened up her own restaurant for a more ideal work schedule. 4/5

ATMOSPHERE: Tables and chairs are mismatched and the cafe is pretty small. The walls are lined with artwork from local artists available for purchase. Music (from the chef's Ipod?) plays in the background. 3/5   

Return Visit?
I'd come back sometime in the future. 

PRO TIP: There's a BOGO entree coupon for Divine Eatery in those Entertainment Books for 2015.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #31

Items Selected:
Fonte Coffee
Hot Biscuit with Honey
Short Stack Red Velvet Pancakes - 2 Chocolately Red Velvet Pancakes with Cream Cheese Icing and Whipped Cream
The Nutty French Toast - Texas Toast with Pecans and Caramel Sauce
The Double Trouble - 4 Deep Fried Oreos, 1 Twinkie, Strawberry Sauce, Powdered Sugar

Located all the way up in Centennial and tucked away in a small business park it was a serendipitous mention by a colleague browsing restaurant.com that lead me through the doors of Divine Eatery just after seven on a bright Saturday morning, my entry met by an empty dining room and warm welcomes from the lone cook and single server.  Not exactly the sort of place one stumbles upon but warm and cheery with local art available for purchase on the walls the menu of Divine Eatery is divided into breakfast/lunch sections for those arriving from 7a-2p with dinner commencing at five o'clock and with both staples and novelties available my order veered towards breakfast - a three part order mistakenly turning into four when my server seemingly read my mind and ordered dessert for me even though I'd not requested it.  Surprisingly soon to swell in patronage as the clock struck 7:30 and reaching perhaps 2/3 capacity by eight it was with several cups of Seattle's Fonte coffee and the restaurant's 80s soundtrack that I passed time until my breakfast arrived and citing Divine's reluctance to stock artificial sweetener "to focus on natural, unprocessed" food I have to say I was a bit let down as all options arrived with artificial maple syrup while the $5 Red Velvet short-stack tasted not only processed but chalky as well.  Turning my attention to the items that worked, both the scratch made buttermilk biscuit and crispy French Toast serving as a sort of crust to a topping of pecan pie proved remarkable while my freebie dessert - not at all natural or unprocessed - was exactly what you'd expect, the strawberry jus sopped up into the light batter of the Twinkie rousing thoughts of the pending summer and shortcake.
You know when there is onions or garlic n your fridge n it flavors anything u have stored of tupperware? That's the food tastes here:( not even for free would I try this place again...yuck!

I have been meaning to try this place for months now since it's close to Mom's and seemed to have good reviews. Unfortunately, I wish we would have just gone to the same old stand by in the area.  We walked in about 9:30 am. The place was empty. We were the only guests. We were hesitant to sit but didn't want to turn and run. We ordered coffees, which they had to make fresh since there was no business.  Happy to have fresh coffee but that was another red flag.  They brew the Costco Columbian ground coffee from the can, not bad but I brew better coffee at home.  They should at least do it where I can't see what I'm paying too much for. We ordered the "throw back" and "pop's omelet sandwich".  Food was underwhelming. Think potatoes home made and they were best part of meal. Omelet sandwich didn't have cheese? I should have read menu description better. We could have made a higher quality and better tasting meal at home. You definitely don't get what you pay for.  Prices are a few bucks too high for the quality of food they are serving.   Maybe their overhead is too high.  Server was very friendly and attentive.
Went for breakfast. A friendly home-like environment. The food was good. We would go back for a meal close to home.

You have to try the Funky Monkey! A candied banana?!? What?!? Oh it is so good. That was my husband's breakfast. I ordered the Country Benedict and that was sooo good. My two daughters got the s'more pancake and the strawberry pancakes. Can I just say that the pancakes are to die for. I can never get them to be that fluffy or taste like that. Oh, they make great coffee here. You have to come here and try it!

The Northwest is becoming one of my new favorite places to hang out. Probably more so now that they have actual places to visit up there. What was once a barren no man's land is sprouting new businesses. Divine Eatery is one of those places. I tend to be pretty critical about breakfast based places because they tend to be overpriced for stuff I can make at home. 

With Divine Eatery, I could probably make most of the items myself. Then I watch the owner make hollandaise sauce from scratch and think that I would rather not. There are many reasons why I like them more than their competition. 

One: there is this cool shabby chic look to the establishment. All the mismatched tables, chairs, and service ware is neat. It takes the stress off of a business to find a singular distributor while giving the restaurant a relaxed and home like feel. 

Two: The food is unpretentious. It is just comfortable food. I had the three egg omelet. The best part, it comes with five additional toppings. No one does that. Usually it is a three item limit. It would have been easier for me to tell her what I didn't want in my meal. When it came out, the eggs were cooked beautifully with a good amount of spinach, mushrooms, peppers, jalapenos, and avocado. The home fries were soft and pillowy on the inside and seasoned to perfection. The pancakes were fluffy and came in a mountain sized portion. The whipped butter and fresh strawberries are a nice touch. Between the three of us, we were unable to finish the mound. Of course, we each had our own dishes, but it was too much. For the quality of food, the price point is reasonable. 

Three: The service is attentive and friendly. The open style kitchen makes it feel like being inside someone's home. It was nice to be able to talk to the owner as she was preparing our meal. I just hope to be able to catch them when they have some daily specials. After my friends told me about the loco moco, I cannot stop thinking about getting one.

Such a cute little cafe. I love how it's only couple minutes from our house. Second time being here but first time for my husband. They have really good Seattle coffee :) we both got 2 eggs and bacon combo with French toast. Everything was really good, especially the French toast. Would definitely recommend it to our friends.
Great local place with a huge menu. Only eaten breakfast but it is one of the best in town.

Okay, I just moved here a few days ago from LA but originally from San Francisco.  I ordered their California Omelette  because it was fully loaded and how I like it.  While I was savoring the omelette it reminded me of this place in the Haight-Ashbury back in the early '70s.  Atmosphere is mellow and service is great.  Everyone was enjoying their meals.  A place to relax and enjoy the food.  Will be back to try other items on the menu.  Hey, why not it's only a 5 minute walk.
Great food and kind competent service. We would highly recommend this place over any other breakfast and lunch restaurant in the area.

Strong coffee (fonte) which is what we serve at work (wynn) and good food! There were some negative reviews, lucky for us we had a good experience. My husband ordered the throwback it was a little small so he had to order another side of french toast. Other than that everything was good.
New owners, the service was very friendly. Coffee was really good. Pancakes were yummy. Will be back.

Great find in NW! Service & food was outstanding. Many menu choices. Love supporting local businesses and this will be one of our new breakfast & lunch places to eat.
They are open for breakfast & lunch everyday. They have taken doing good food and service to a high level.
Their coffee is some of the best- blend is perfect for first cup of joe in the morning.
Portions are generous and prices reasonable.
Great family place to eat!
Will be bring grandsons in soon for pancakes & other delicious food!

This place is an amazing find! Thank you Yelp for introducing us. I've had lunch and breakfast here and they both exceeded expectations! The service is phenomenal. The prices are kind of steep but it's totally worth it! The lunch was great, I had the stairway burger and my friend had the pulled pork, both 5 stars. For breakfast I had the smores pancake and my friend had the nutty French toast and they were both 5 stars.. But the tall stack was a little much and they didn't come with sides which is understandable due to the large quantity of pancakes! Anyway, the server kept offering to go coffee which was awesome, I love places that offer free coffee refills. A lot of reviews on here complain that the coffee was 4$ but now it's 2$ and they offer to go coffee so it's don't listen to those fools! Go to divine eatery now! Now! Now!

Definitely my favorite breakfast spot. From the mix/match seats to local artists' paintings on the walls, I feel like I'm having breakfast at my grandma's house! And that's a lovely thing!

We often get the same server, whose name I believe is Javier. He is a saint, remembering our drink orders each visit and never leaving my cup o' Fonte (aka the best coffee EVER) less than half full and piping hot. He is the best! I've seen him efficiently and calmly serve an entire restaurant of people without breaking a sweat. Whenever we see he's our server, we know it's going to be a good dining experience!

The food is scrumptious. I like that they have lots of vegetarian and healthy options. Watching your diet? Get egg whites for no charge! You can also substitute sides of potatoes and bacon or sausage with a side salad, rice, or berries. 

I don't watch my weight because I am a glutton who is in love with their home fries. Some people might consider them too salty, but I think they're heavenly. The best thing I've ever ordered here is the Frosted Flakes french toast, which consists of rich, thick french toast fried in a crunchy coating of Frosted Flakes cereal and covered with powdered sugar and berries. They will probably be the cause of my inevitable diabetes and/or weight gain, but I don't care. They're delicious!

Prices are a little steeper here than at most diners, but it's well worth it to avoid the blandness and monotony of IHOP and Denny's. Just say no to fast food breakfast chains, and say YES to Divine Eatery!

This is our first week living in Las Vegas and we live not to far from Divine Eatery.  We went there for lunch and were blown away!  Service was great, food was wonderful and fresh.  We will be visiting this place again soon!
Amazing food. Ordered the Denver omelette with one pancake. Omelette was fresh, potatoes were perfect and pancake was delicious. Awesome place to grub and the price is fair for the quality of food.

Love the freshness of the food, love the staff, love that the chef keeps you guessing, and I love how I am treated. Highly recommend to anyone that wants a place to eat that does not use processed foods. Customer service is top notch. Great place to makes friends and brake bread.
My favorite breakfast spot in LV. I've eaten brunch/breakfast all over this city. This place has the friendliest staff and their food is always good!
Great service. Friendly and accommodating. Music is a bit too rock but not super loud.

*Military discount* 

Went on Sunday 8-30-15 around 12:30 PM.  This restaurant is located on the corner of Hualapai and Elkhorn.  It did not look promising from the outside, sandwiched between a tobacco shop and a dog groomers but we threw caution to the wind and entered. Inside we found approximately ten tables, all of which are a hodge-podge mix of yard sale junk all fixed up.  There is a bench by the front door...oh my lord, that bench....it took all I had not to have my friend distract the waiter and run out the door with that bench.  Best part about the whole place, honestly.  

It seems like a bunch of middle-eastern dudes decided to open up a breakfast place.  Heck, they may even run the tobacco store two doors down.  $13.51 got me a pulled pork sandwich, fries, and the most expensive glass of apple juice I've ever had at $3.95 and no refills. Why, oh why, did I decide to get a pulled pork sandwich at an Armenian-American breakfast restaurant is beyond me.  It was a bad decision.  

The sandwich looked quite lovely, but imagine week-old pulled pork thrown on the grill top and re-heated with no barbecue sauce and cole slaw.  The pork was crispy.  I took a couple bites and put it down.  It was wretched.   It was served with real potato french fries.  They kind of reminded me of well-done In-N-Out fries with no salt.  

And then today, I am reminded of Kevin Buckman's song from the movie Parenthood (1989): When you're sliding into first and you're feeling something burst, diarrhea, diarrhea. When you're sliding into third and you feel a juicy turd, diarrhea, diarrhea. When you're sliding into home and your pants are full of foam, diarrhea, diarrhea. When you're driving in your Chevy and your pants are feeling heavy, diarrhea, diarrhea. 

I was going to give this place 3 stars but something happened while we were dining that bumped it down a star for me.  A customer walked out the front door and bit the dust on the pavement.  This poor old lady was laying there and only one employee from this restaurant went over to help.  Five male employees were sitting inside drinking coffee and one of them said "Must have been her high heels." 

 Now, call me too sensitive, but any place that won't help an old lady and gave me the runs is a place I will never go back to.
Great staff!!! The boys are so nice and the service is awesome! I live in LA but went to this restaurant my last two vegas trips. Potatoes are a bit hard tho.
Got the California omelette, it was great. I just like how it was cooked right. Not under cooked like some places I've been to.

This is my third time here and just not having a pleasant experience. First time,  order took 18 minutes, there were only three tables! Second time, order was completely wrong! So I said. I'm not coming back here.... but here I am again, four months later, and my last visit. I ordered French toast, with side of scrambled eggs and avocado.... and of course coffee. No silverware, had to get my own from another table...  The scrambled eggs were served first. I'm like what??? So my eggs are sitting alone on the table waiting for the rest to arrive. I don't get why it's served separately... coffee is not fresh.  I'm really sad.

Finally got to try here today. We had a party if 3, including 1 toddler. The waiter greeted us as soon as we entered. We ordered waters and knew that we wanted French toast. It's nice they offer smaller servings. We ordered a full order of the regular one, a half order of the funky monkey and small order of pancakes. 
There wasn't a long wait for our food and there were 5 other tables occupied. 
The food taste pretty good. The only downfall was that we were hoping for bigger pieces of French toast. It was on the tinier side, so if you're really hungry it would be best to order something else or more food. I like how it was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Hoping to come back soon and try their other menu items

This is a small cafe with very limited seating.  I like that they display work from local artist and decor is eclectic.  It reminds me of the small "mom and pop" restaurants back home in the Midwest.  The wait staff is very friendly even though they are very busy.  The "good coffee" (anything other than Folger's) is $4.  I ordered an omelet with sour dough toast.  It was very tasty but I had to scoop out a lot of grilled onions.  Over all it is a nice place to eat with nice staff and good food.  I wouldn't drive too far to eat there but if you live in the area it's a good place to stop.

We ate here for breakfast and very surprisingly they were not very busy. The service was phenomenal, the food delicious and the prices reasonable. The restaurant was very homie and clean! Great location.  We will definitely be back soon!!

Hands down best breakfast place in town. The food is amazing! I had the chorizo burrito & crunchy French toast. Hubby had a chili omelette & nutty French toast. I regret not taking pictures of the food. Tasted as good as it looked. I'm super picky about my coffee. No complaints here. Sam was our waiter. She's amazing! Great food, great service! Just sorry we just discovered this place. Definitely coming back.
This was my second visit to this place today I ate the Chicken Fried Steak it was inedible!

Amazing! Real, non-franchised restaurant with great people that work there and a wonderful chef! The Funky Monkey french toast was delicious. The Chorizo skillet was robust with flavor and spice! We will be back!

Mehhhhh....I was wholey underwhelmed by what I ordered here. The pancakes were okay, the eggs and sausage and potatoes were a little bland all together, and the coffee (from what I hear) was not so good. The service was friendly enough and the local artwork on the walls was a nice touch. But overall, it just felt like the whole restuarant was half put together. It was "eclectic" but kind of in a "we don't really know what we're going for so lets just paint the walls a bright color, put up totally random artwork, and put mismatching chairs and tables together..."

It was nice that they had lots of brunch options, but overall, I wouldn't necessarily drive out of my way to come here.

Seat yourself, but every open table is dirty. After we sat down, she came and wiped it though. Very friendly service. My meat lovers breakfast burrito was good. I asked her for a side of sour cream, which she asked the kitchen for, but as she was the only one on the floor, she was busy taking an order when the sour cream came up from the chef. So I got up and grabbed it myself which I totally didn't mind, but most people probably wouldn't have taken that initiative. She was attentive and asked how the food was and if we wanted refills. The table next to us had dirty dishes sitting on it the entire time we were there. Apparently texting was more important to her co-worker. I did like my food, but the servers need a bit more training/direction. As someone who has worked at a restaurant, if you've got time to lean, you've got time to clean! The lineup of chairs through the hallway to the restroom was an interesting look.

Quick service and clean shop. Friendly staff and most importantly, GOOD FOOD! I had the spicy Buffalo wrap with garlic fries, my boo had the tuna melt, and my kid- chicken fingers (of course). We all really enjoyed our meal after a tough morning picking pumpkins. I'd definitely come back to try the breakfast options!!

This place is awesome! We order take out from this place weekly. The order is always correct and still hot when we get it home. Everyone is friendly when we go inside to pick it up. Our favorites are the biscuits and gravy, blta, and divine pancakes. Can't wait to try more of the menu!

Came in for breakfast on a Wednesday morning. It wasn't very busy, the waiter was just the right amount of attentive. Not over the top checking in every 5 mins and not "have you seen our waiter? I've been waiting for a refill for 15 minutes" he was right in the middle. Wish I would've gotten his name.
The food was good. The only bad hung was the potatoes weren't seasoned.

I dropped my dog off to be groomed at Groomer Has It and stopped by for breakfast. I had fluffy pancakes topped with strawberries and sausage and tea. It's a very pleasant atmosphere and my waitress was so friendly. I had a bit of a coughing spell and she offered me water and tea with lemon. It was just enough. I would definitely return. Customer Service seems to be a dying art but Devine Eatery Nailed it!
